Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, wonderful staff - but book directly with them”
Reviews.Author: Alex R
Reviews.Content: Let me start out this way - BOOK THIS HOTEL BY CALLING THEM DIRECTLY! We booked with Expedia and got screwed. Expedia charged well in excess (over $30 night more) then the rates the hotel advertizes directly. They booked us for the cheapest room (full size bed), which there listing implied that the bed was a queen. They did not indicate that parking has to be reserved with hotel as they have limited spaces. Having said all that - when we got to the hotel, the staff was able to address all of our concerns - which took them quite a bit of effort as they were nearly fully booked - and they did so at no cost. The hotel itself is wonderful. It is a boutique hotel - services are a bit limited - but the rooms are nice, staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is 1 building off from the beach, 5 min. walk from Shopping in Condado, while on a quiet street. The restaurant in the hotel is pricy, but some of the best food around San Juan. Once we got over the arrival problems, we had a wonderful stay and can definitely recommend it to anyone looking for an alternative to a big-resort experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FWN N
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our stay at Acacia. The hotel is in an excellent location situated on the outskirts of Condado. Easy walking distance to restaurants, nightlife and the beach. The room was small, but well appointed. The rattan furniture is a nice touch, giving it a tropical feel. The bathroom is large for its size and the terra cotta shower was roomy. We could hear the Coqui frogs at night with the windows open and the breeze blowing into the room. The staff was extremely helpful with transportation and locating places to eat or visit. Beach chairs and towels are available at the front desk for use at the beach a mere one minute walk from to hotel. The citrus water was delicious and we usually filled a bottle before heading out. Lastly, the hotel restaurant Niche is outstanding. The food was fantastic. The waitstaff was superb and Hector made a wonderful Mojito and Champagne spritzer. Overall a nice vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Caution-Even if you book this hotel and have a confirmation you may not get it!”
Reviews.Author: KfromBoston
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation for this hotel, have the confirmation and called a week ahead of time to confirm (after having the reservation for months) because of all the issues I've seen on TripAdvisor and Yelp about hotels moving/changing folks. Well, it happened to us and we too were informed that we'd been rebooked in one of their sister properties (which had mixed reviews). Upon calling the hotel we were informed they had overbooked and so we were being moved, they were pleasant about it but unaccommodating. I'm a frequent business and pleasure traveler and have had my share of travel mishaps and thanks to this site I knew to call ahead and verify my reservation. My bottom line is if I wanted their sister property I would have booked it and now I have a new reseravation with an entirely different hotel chain. Be warned ....just because you have a confirmation with the Acacia doesn't mean you actually have a room!

Reviews.Title: “How do You Define Convenience? Poor Room Block Management”
Reviews.Author: mychaeljacobnyc
Reviews.Content: First time I've had to submit an unfavorable review, so forive me if I stumble through this one. My wife & I are frequent travelers and I'm proud at the number of my reviews that have been read on this website, ( 3 reviews away from Senior Reviewer Badge).. This website has served us well over the past few years, so you can imagine our surprise at how far off the strong reviews of this hotel was; compared to our experience. * First I want to accenuate the positives: 1.) hotel located in safe neighborhood Condado. 2.) kudos to the housekeeping staff/rooms were kept clean. 3.) nice semi-private beach 1/2 block from hotel. ** Full Disclosure- we recognize that amenities vary on the importance scale from each individual/group or couple. What may be a deal breaker for some may not be for others. But what I do want to bring to anyone considering this location is first the definition of convenient. I saw on other reviews that this hotel was convenient to shopping, etc.. My wife & I are New Yorkers and no strangers to walking, and we found the walk to the nearest shopping area a little further than your standard defintion of convenient. It is a pleasant walk, but do not attempt this walk in sandals. HA.. *** Addressing the Poor Room Management: Our Check In was South of "warm & fuzzy". Instead we were greeted with indifference. Nothing better than having the Front Desk Attendant (first name began with an S) acting as if she was doing us a favor by checking us in. Please dont confuse indifferent with rude, because the exchange was pleasnat. However, when you give the owner a compliment of "nice place" and you get answered with "all smoke & mirrors" you start to wonder if they are in the wrong business. HA What confirmed my suspicion was the room they gave us, room 207. The room had (2) King Beds (if you call 2 twin beds put togther a king) that was very narrow and claustrophobically tight. I noticed the room right next to ours was empty with a much nicer king bed and definitely better suited for a Couple. The hotel was at maybe 20% occupancy, and when I inquired with the same front desk attendant if the Empty room next door was a higher rate than ours, I was told it was the same rate!! I had to ask myself, if you see we are a couple on a romantic get away weekend, and you have a much nicer, EMPTY room at the same rate available, why would you give a couple a cramped (2) king bed room??? Poor Room Block Management!! In closing this "boutique" hotel is run by individuals who either know very little about simple hospitality or just dont care. We could handle the fact the property has no elevator, only stairs that are exposed to the elements to your room (like rain in our case),or if you wanted a snack & simple cup of coffee you have to walk accross the street to their sister property. In reality it falls short with amenities you would find at even 3 star hotels, and couples would do better staying at a chain hotel further down the road where you are truly walking distance to shops and most importantly treated as a valued guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great, if you are only looking for beach vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jenifer H
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ Acacia for recent escape from NYC. Not what was expected. Many reviews submitted on Tripadvisor have great comments and wonder about their experiences. Reserved king, deluxe room but wonder where the "deluxe" part was. What we got was 2 king beds, (which is really, 2 twins put side by side). Made the room very tight to maneuver around. No closet, but hangers on a wall rack. No full length mirror but the mirror on top of chest-height dresser can be full length if hung from wall. (Spent time standing on top of bed to look in mirror and ducking from ceiling fan. Or, if I was on the floor, standing on tippie toes. I am 5'8".) No refrigerator. Keys to enter hotel property worked only sometimes. (Had to change keys twice 2 front desk. Gave up after that and resolved to fact that the keys are tempermental.) Great beach location but otherwise inconvenient to restaurants, nightlife and Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay at the Acacia”
Reviews.Author: Brian P
Reviews.Content: After traveling around the island we spent our last 2 nights at the Acacia. The hotel itself is beautiful and the staff very warm, friendly, and helpful. Our room was clean and had a ocean view with a balcony that was very nice. We also enjoyed the large hot tob/mini pool outside on the second floor of the building. Note it is luke warm, which is really nice when it can be so hot outside. I would give it a complete 5 points but for us it was a bit far from Old San Juan. We had already spent a week at the beach in other parts of the island so we were not drawn to the beach close to the hotel. It is a public beach with volleyball, swimming, ect, but also very crowded compared to the beaches around the island. Fof this reason we spent most of our time in Old San Juan which is AMAZING but a 15 minute drive away. Supposedly there is a bus that runs their easily, but we were very happy to have a car to make the trip there and back. Next point is parking is an extra fee and a must if you have a car. We parked illegally for 10 minutes outside the hotel and recieved a $250 parking ticket, FYI. Bottom line is the hotel and building are incredible and location is great if you want to be close to the beach and in a more local neighborhood. If your primary focus for being in San Juan is the old town, I would try to stay closer to old town.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a GEM!”
Reviews.Author: BlueDonut42
Reviews.Content: I booked this place for two or maybe three reasons. It was a small boutique hotel, looked quaint, some good reviews and you could walk to the beach. The outside was just as I imagined and how it looked in pictures. At first I didn't know how to get in and someone standing outside informed us that you had to ring the buzzer. When you walk in the lounge area had a modern yet tropical feeling with all of the big plants I wanted to take home with me and put in my living room. loud. We were quickly greeted by the concierge and apparently the operations manager whom everyone talks about here. I booked back in February of 2011- yes, it took me an entire year to write this review, but better now than never. Chad was just wonderful, always asking us if we needed anything whenever we would see him, but not overbearing. He really made us feel at home. Our room was very comfortable, clean and we had a nice view of the ocean and beach from our window. Make sure to check out the lovely jacuzzi, the top notch regular mojitos or the coconut mojitos made by Donna which are phenomenal. You MUST eat chef Christian's wonderful creations in Niche. My favorites were the mussels which were like butter, duck confit tacos, whole red snapper and ceviche. The front desk gave us restaurants to check out that were more high end, but not too expensive ans all of them were excellent. We asked about zip lining, and other tourists attractions and they were always so helpful. This place was more relaxing than I expected. Everyone made us feel relaxed and comfortable- service was great! Thank you Chad and all the staff for making our stay at your lovely hotel worthwhile. What a charming place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “My new vacation HOME in PR!”
Reviews.Author: NYCRevie
Reviews.Content: I visit PR 2-3 times a year and as a creature of habit, I go for my creature comforts and stay in the same hotel. I have a greeat experience there, most of the time and little to few complaints. i decide to expand my horizons and stay in a different area-more of a neighborhood, but still having great access to restaurants, nightlife and of course, the beach. I booked a stay at The Acacia and, frankly, I am not looking back. This fab,stylish,sweet and most inportantly well run hotel is now the only place i want to stay. Chad, The GM, went out of his way to accomodate me and the staff is truly on point. Susanna, Ari, Hector and Josean made me feel like I wa at home from the time I arrived and I was actually sad to leave. The view from my amazing room with the wrap around balcony, the quality of care and service i recieved and a restaurant, Noche, that was beyond excellent...even for this Jaded New York Gal. I will be booking my next vist soon and THIS IS THE PLACE!!!

Reviews.Title: “"off the beaten path"”
Reviews.Author: Peter H
Reviews.Content: The Acacia Hotel is charming, comfortable & friendly. The entire staff at Acacia couldn't be nicer or do more to make your stay with them perfect. I highly recommend the hotel when staying in the San Juan area. I was in PR on business & the hotel provided a quiet restful atmosphere to unwind at the end of the day. Peter H

Reviews.Title: “A little treasure in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Andre A
Reviews.Content: A perfect, intimate boutique hotel 30 seconds from the beach in a quaint part of San Juan. The hotel is friendly, clean, a Gem!!!

Reviews.Title: “Funky, comfy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lid_9
Reviews.Content: Great choice of hotel. My sister had a wedding and her and fiancÃ© checked out few places to suggest. 5 or 6 couples / singles stayed here. We had 6 nights, greeted by Suzanna and shown around, so we knew lay of the hotel. Rooms were large enough and comfortable. Walk- in large shower. Nice to have assortment of beach chairs provided. Beach towels provided. Perfect sandy beach with fun to play in ocean waves. Separate entrance when we came from beach, and used shower to remove sand on feet. Spent lots of time in large jacuzzi, with family members and friends: perfect temperature. Front desk always got us taxi service within 5-10 minutes. We also took bus into Old San Juan about 2 blocks away (#21 & 53). Convenient location. On last day with 11am checkout, we left bags, stayed at beach, and used shower on 4th floor before heading to airport. We highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: karinf74
Reviews.Content: Lovely property just off Conada beach. The one drawback is that the ocean itself is largely blocked by a couple of unfortunate apartment blocks. But the hotel itself is pleasant and well-thought-out, relaxing in a low-key way. I especially liked the sea breeze off the balcony and the hot tub and pool. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The location is a drive to Old San Juan, but it's convenient to the beach and within walking distance of the art museum and bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not as wonderful as they think they are”
Reviews.Author: Beentherebe4_x2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully situated in a quiet residential neighbourhood. Half a block from a decent beach. Those are the pros. The cons: very unprofessional front desk service. After getting no answer at the door we traipsed over to the sister hotel a block away, with two heavy bags, and then traipsed back again. (This, after a five hour flight.) Finally someone let us in. Our room (advertised as "ocean view") faced directly in front of a hot tub/plunge pool, so there was a lot of traffic, noise, and absolutely no privacy. we had to keep our curtains shut whenever we were in the room, which meant getting dressed in the dark. The in-house restaurant is pricey (three sea scallops for $36.00) and not nearly as good as many other restaurants in the area. Only on our last day did we become aware that the hotel lends beach chairs--no one bothered to tell us. We left and checked in to El Convento--fifty per cent higher price, but ten times the quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to be(like home)”
Reviews.Author: Irene N
Reviews.Content: I have never meet a group of warm hearted and friendliest people that worked at a hotel. The staff at the Acacia Boutique hotel was all that. When I return back to Pureto Rico this is where I want to stay. My mother and myself went for my 50th birthday and I couldn't pick a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but try not to get bumped”
Reviews.Author: clcoop28
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at Acacia and it was nice and unique. The atmosphere was cool and the room had a great balcony for a standard room. The ocean is also only one block and an easy walk. The hot tub is huge and very nice however it was not working correctly and was no warmer then room temperature. We were with another couple who got bumbed due to overbooking and they had to stay at the windchimes which they hated.Beware of the bump as we have heard other people have this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jason U
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon in December `11. The room was great, always clean. There was never a lot of foot traffic even though we were next to the enormous jacuzzi. The fruit infused water was always delicious and everyone was always helpful. Last, but not least, Chad was ever present and focused on customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: golfho
Reviews.Content: Acacia was great little fine. Room was clean. The pool was awesome. We stayed at Acacia on Friday the 13 of Jan. 2012. The staff was great when we check in and great when we check out. We left Saturday the 14th for a cruise. The young lady behind the desk called a cab for us. Little did we know their was a big festival. She said that their wasn't any cab because of the festival. But she kept calling and got us a cab to the ship. The only thing i was disappointed in is that we were going to eat breakfast at the restaurant and it wasn't open. If you want a quiet little place to stay this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great people”
Reviews.Author: Autresejour
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Acacia for 2nights before cruise .It lives up to all of the positive comments on previous reviews. The key distinguishment in my opinion is the service oriented focus of the entire staff.they are the real deal...Chad,Claudio,Ari,Susanna. Try it folks...you wont be disappointed.Im already planning on doing a drive-around Puerto Rico trip next winter and will most definately utilize Acacia as the starting point and terminus of my trip..plus some time in Culebra which they told me was great. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for San Juan”
Reviews.Author: SherylK
Reviews.Content: We had a great 5 night stay here. Front desk staff here (and at Windchimes, the sister hotel where we parked) could not have been more helpful in every way. Location in Condado comfortable for walking home at night and one block from the beach - but on a very quiet residential street. Loved the hot tub each night (really a 10x30 pool at a higher-than usual temperature.) On-site restaurant was small and closed one night so we didn't explore. Plenty of other places to eat locally though. Easy to drive or take bus to Old San Juan, close to highway to get to El Yunque, Luquillo, etc.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Ocean Park San Juan”
Reviews.Author: WintersR4beaches
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Acacia our last 3 days in San Juan. As everyone has said, it is not a resort. It is a lovely little hotel tucked away in a residential section of San Juan literally steps from the beach. Our balcony overlooked their huge jacuzzi. You'd think it would be noisy but actually the room was very quiet. We enjoyed sitting on the balcony with the breakfast we bought at a nearby 24 hour well stocked supermarket. We heard raves about the Niche restaurant there but being on a budget led us more to the local restaurants and the supermarket. The Niche was a bit pricey for us but well worth it I'm told. My only complaint was a lack of mini-fridge in the room. Understandable since they have their own restaurant. The Acacia is not close to Old San Juan but a block away from the bus route there. The front desk people were helpful with bus route and other information. They kindly allowed us to leave our luggage when we arrived early and left late. If you're looking for a quiet, comfortable place to stay, the Acacia's the one.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not great.”
Reviews.Author: Empty-Nesters1956
Reviews.Content: We stayed with two other couples at this hotel in mid-January at the time of the San Sebastian Festival in Old San Juan. The hotel is located near (but not on) the beach in a residential area midway between the main tourist/casino hotels and the San Juan airport. There are few places of interest in the immediate vicinity, but a hospital is less than a five minute walk should that prove necessary. The property is a bit "quirky" with different shaped rooms and no elevator. Our room was nice but not luxurious. The front desk was very helpful in calling taxis and arranging a private tour of the Rain Forest. If you want a small hotel away from crowds, this place will work. If you want an on-beach, resort experience, the Acacia Boutique Hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Were Expecting.”
Reviews.Author: cpearl
Reviews.Content: We sure wish we had paid more attention to the negative reviews of this hotel, but after all the glowing reports we chose this place for a post cruise stay. I have to say that we agree with a lot of the negative stuff said about the Acacia. It seems that most of the resources went into the jacuzzi pool which is nice and the hotel lobby. There is no elevator and if you are on the third floor like we were it is several flights of steep stairs , not fun when you have luggage to drag up. Also, the room was very small and cheaply furnished. My computer monitor is bigger than the TV in it. There is no closet. The room was also not too clean, there were several long black hairs on the pillow cases when we first got into the room and the shower stall was grimy, it seems that broken terra cotta shards that are mortared together are not easy to keep clean. Also the young woman who was at the front desk was not very friendly or at all helpful. We were told by the clerk during the evening that there would be coffee served in the lobby in the morning, but then were told we would have to walk two blocks down the street to the windchimes to get a coffee. What's with that? The nearby beach is nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: Diane G
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel on Tuesday Evening January 10,2012. I have to say that it was the worst experience ever. We had reservations at "A Wind Chimes" hotel and were told they did not have our reservation but we could stay at their sister hotel, Acacia. We were told at ten o,clock at night to carry our bags down the very dark street to the Acacia. Wait a moment, we were booked at one hotel and switched to another. For two weary travelers it was to much to comprehend and we trudged to the Acacia. Beware upon arrival they slam you with there rules one of which is you can not get your money back if the room does not meet your expectations. I awoke to having a severe allergic reaction which I recognized instantly as being the result of the presence of mold. My husband investigated and found considerable mold in the bathroom and air conditioner. My husband and I agreed that we could not remain at the hotel. We expressed our desire to leave the hotel to the desk clerk who referred the matter to her manager.The manager was a very rude women who in no uncertain terms advised us that we had booked a four night stay and if we desired to leave we would be charged for a three night stay. To our shock, the problems my wife was having with the mold in the room WERE COMPLETELY IGNORED!!! We left the hotel very bitter and completely resentful of the way we were treated. So beware if you should become ill or have an emergency you will be in for the three night stay rule.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to feel at home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Mary F
Reviews.Content: Just based on previous reviews, I wanted to experience a more intimate stay where I can feel safe. When I arrived at Acacia late that night I knew it was the right choice. The receptionist in the front desk was pleasant and friendly. It was a beautiful night complemented by the perfect weather. The next morning it was great to meet other staff members and to find out the great food they had at niche their restaurant; That evening at the restaurant of course Chad intuitively introduce me to a wonderful couple that made the evening enjoyable. It you want to experience personalize attention I highly recommend this cozy, to a degree enchanted hidden place.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, lousy service”
Reviews.Author: stephen r
Reviews.Content: This is a pleasant looking hotel in a good location close to the beach that forgot they are in the service industry. This experience left me with a bad taste in my mouth that would prevent me from using this hotel or their sister hotel "At Wind Chimes Inn," as well. When I called to make the reservation, the phone person "Ed" said I should call back later since they were changing shifts. This sounds more like a lazy clerk than a motivated employee. I had found the hotel through a website called "purple roofs." They advertised a 10% discount on that website, but when I made my reservation, none of the desk clerks had heard of such a discount. I called and emailed within 24 hours to verify the discount but never heard back from a hotel representative regarding the discount. When we checked in, Chad, the manager said he'd credit our accounts with the 10%, but ultimately came up with a lame excuse not to honor the discount stating our rooms were already discounted (we were booked for new years week and the price we paid ($185 for a king size and $175 for the queen) was higher than the prices listed on the back of the hotel room doors. These were not discounted prices). Upon arrival, we found that they sold one of our king sized bedrooms to some one else. Instead, they tried to sell us a moldy smelling room with no windows, tucked behind the kitchen. Ultimately, they found a queen sized room that was adequate. Our other room, a king size, had two twin beds tied together. The rooms were pleasant, although quite small. One room didn't have a closet. The balcony furniture was the stackable plastic stuff one buys at KMart. The wireless network didn't have a strong enough signal to reach the rooms on the second or third floor, so even though they advertise wireless internet, it's not available. On the day we checked in, we had asked about finding a gym to work out at. The desk clerk had no idea where to recommend, but he did find us a gym, on our last night there. This is a hotel that tries to be a three or four star hotel, but I've had better service at Motel 6. Certainly a disappointment

Reviews.Title: “sunny in san juan”
Reviews.Author: SlvrBel
Reviews.Content: landed in san juan for a cruise. this hotel easily accomodates folks in route and those returning from cruise ships. stylistic and understated beach accommodations. The beach in right down the street. awesome staff; contemporary setting, go for the balcony room... no elevators...romantic setting. mounted flat screens and comfortable bedding.

Reviews.Title: “really disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jbredle
Reviews.Content: After reading so many glowing reviews of this place, I was surprised to find it so disappointing. Typically when a hotel has so many positive reviews on TripAdvisor you're pretty much guaranteed a fantastic stay, but I didn't find that to be the case here. We spent $185/night for a room with a balcony and partial ocean view, but what we got was a small area between our door and the hot tub with a view of the people in the hot tub. There was no privacy, but our balcony had no chairs to sit on anyway. The staff told us we could take other people's chairs. In fact, our room didn't have a chair either. What it had was two twin beds pushed together, a dresser, a metal rod for hanging clothes and a flat screen tv. The bed is a little short if you're 6'3" (my legs were hanging off the end and this killed my back, although the hot tub straightened it out). Is this worth $185/night? You could probably find something a lot less expensive for these amenities. The staff was very nice, though the only information we got upon checking in was where the ice machine was. They told me they needed my credit card for incidentals and I thought it was a joke. I don't know what we could have bought. They do have a restaurant where you can buy 30$ pizzas. They are close to a very nice beach, although in December the trade winds are so strong that it seems too cold and rough to swim. Getting to Old San Juan is a $20 taxi ride. Ocean Park and Condado are okay but not nearly as nice as Old San Juan. This was my 6th time in the Caribbean, my first in Puerto Rico. This was the most money I'd ever spent on accommodations, so I expected it to at least be as good as the places I've stayed in the Dominican Republic, Trinidad & Tobago, St. Lucia and Barbados. In all of those places, I spent less money for a full apartment, ocean view, and private balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality thatn chains don't understand.”
Reviews.Author: Sam0701
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Acacia in 2009, for one night before our cruise. Weâ€™d been in Florida for a week doing the parks with the rest of our family and needed a night of peace and quiet before we commenced our cruise on our own. There is no shortage of choice in SJ, but Iâ€™m so glad we stayed here. We got a welcome that you just donâ€™t get at a chain and we were directed to our room. The room itself has everything you need. Ours was on the first floor and looked out towards the beach (which you could see a bit of) with a small balcony, air con, ceiling fan and a charming, unusual bathroom. Itâ€™s not going to give you the plushness of a chain hotel, but this is the only sacrifice â€“ everything else is a gain. In the same block there is a long hot tub, which you can also see part of the beach from. There are also rooms that adjoin the hot tub area, but this would not be my choice. They we also accommodating enough to offer to look after our bags when we returned from the cruise as we had a few hours between disembarking the ship and our flight back to London via Miami. We didnâ€™t use it as we met some friends on the ship we spent time with at the airport. A year later we went on a cruise again with our family to get married. We were informed by our airline that our flight time had been moved and there were 8 adults and 2 children with about 5 hours to fill in SJ. I wouldnâ€™t go to San Juan out of choice and needed some rest before the flight â€“ so I immediately emailed the Acacia and explained the problem, the day before. They were so accommodating as they had a spare room. They hired us a room for the 5 hours, allowed us and the children to use the hot tub and the pool. They also gave us enough towels to each have a shower and freshen up before the hike back to London. Thatâ€™s what hospitality is all about. Thank you. As I said before, SJ is not a destination of choice for me â€“ but next time I find myself there, Iâ€™ll be checking into Acacia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice intimate hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuneSNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from San Juan last week. We go to San Juan at least 2 -3 times a year and usually stay in Condado. This time, we wanted to stay in a quite area close to Condado, and after debating between Acacia and another hotel in the neighborhood, we decided to stay at Acacia Boutique Hotel, solely based on all the good reviews that Acacia received. The hotel is located in Ocean Park, relatively quiet residential area, approximately 10 minute walk from Condado and about 1 block away from the beach. Other travelers seem to rely on buses and taxis. Buses cost you 75 cents to Old San Juan. But, any time we go to San Juan, we usually rent a car from Charlie Car Rental (we reserve prior to coming to San Juan). Buses are somewhat unreliable. During the summer, we waited for a bus for an hour to get to Old San Juan and nothing ever came and we finally gave up . Taxis are not cheap to get around. Car rentals, however, are extremely cheap in San Juan. For the entire 8 days, we paid $175 in total, averaging $22 a day (I imagine that this is close to one way cab ride to Old San Juan, including tip). We took the shuttle to Charlie Car Rental in Isla Verde from the airport and drove ourselves to the hotel. As it is quite difficult to find a parking space near the hotel, we reserved a parking space at At Wind Chimes Inn (Acaciaâ€™s sister hotel), which cost $10 a night. The parking space is very small and is limited, and can accommodate only a few economy size cars. So, if you are thinking of renting a car, definitely reserve a parking space well in advance. Once you get to the hotel, the front desk will supply you with the beeper to open the gate at the parking. At Wind Chimes Inn is located on McLeary Street, which gets pretty busy depending on the time of the day. So, backing out onto the street with traffic can get tricky at times. Nevertheless, we like the freedom of just jumping into a car and driving wherever, without relying on the public transportation, which we found to be somewhat unreliable (although we saw many more buses drive by this time). Getting back to Acacia, we were there for 8 days from December 7th through 14th. The hotel is dog friendly. So, we stayed with our 2 well behaved Chihuahuas (we love traveling with our dogs and we never leave them behind. We look specifically for dog friendly accommodations when we travel to Caribbean. St. Martin is another good place for dogs). The hotel charges a small fee per night for dogs, about $20 a night, if I remember correctly. The hotel is quite small and intimate, 3 floors with no elevators. It is all white and the architecture has â€œMediterraneanâ€� feel to it. By the way, be very careful when you go down the stairs, especially when it rains. The stairs get quite slippery. I fell down quite badly after the rain, walking down the stairs with flip flops, which had no grip. I hit my hip and elbow pretty badly, and I was in pain for days. Since then, I walked down the stairs barefoot even at night and carrying my heals when we went out for dinner. The area is not well lit either at night, particularly the 3rd floor. When you check into the hotel, the front desk will provide you with a room key, which also opens the front door to the hotel. Check-in is from 2 p.m. to 10 p.m. We arrived at the airport earlier. But, we opted to have lunch at one of our favorite restaurants in Condado, Ummo Argentinean Grill and arrived at the hotel shortly past 2 p.m. Check-in was quite efficient. They took the credit card information and showed us around the hotel and its facility, although we knew the way around, since we came to check out the hotel during our last trip in the summer. The hotel helped us with our luggage, and we were in our room, in no time. Check-out is quite early, at 11 a.m. Our flight did not leave till later. So, we requested a late check-out, at 1 p.m. The hotel will also hold your luggage for you after you check out and I believe that there is a room that you can use to shower etc. If this is not what you want, you can make arrangements with the hotel to stay in your room later, provided that there are no other guests arriving on that day. However, the hotel charges $25 an hour for every hour past 11 a.m. you would like to stay in your room. We paid $50 additional fee to stay in our room till 1 p.m. We reserved a King Deluxe room and stayed in room 308. We liked the location of our room, as the room is situated in the corner on the top floor, and no one will walk by our room to get to his/her room. The room was very clean and decorated very nicely. We had a king size bed with a canopy hanging over from the ceiling (the mattress was on the firm side but comfortable), large flat screen TV with cable (i.e., English channels), drawer space to put your clothes, and A/C, which worked very well. The room had no alarm clock. The bathroom had shower only, which didnâ€™t bother us and the shower had nice hot water at all times of the day, unlike some other hotels in the neighborhood. The hotel supplies you with basic amenities such as shampoo, conditioner, soap and had hair drier, iron and small ironing board. The only drawback was that the room was extremely small, and so was the bathroom. There was no closet space to hang your clothes. There was a space to hang your clothes in the bathroom. But, once you hang your clothes, there was hardly any space to move around in the bathroom. I think that the rooms situated next to us (rooms 307 and 306) were much larger (we sort of peaked in). The room had a safe. But, when we first arrived, the prior guest did not return the key. So, we could not use it for the first 2 days. But, the hotel quickly changed the lock when we brought to the attention of the front desk. The hotel charges a small fee, about $2 a night to use the in-room safe. The view from the hotel room and from the Jacuzzi (the hotel is known for having the largest Jacuzzi, which is 34 x 12 with 18 water jets and a heating system that everyone rave about) is ok. You can see the ocean one block away behind the palm trees. But, because the hotel is located in the residential area, it is surrounded by much taller condos. So, you will have a view of whole bunch of buildings, which I would say is not the nicest. The hotel breakfast was excellent. The hotel has a very small restaurant, Niche, downstairs and there is a very small outdoor part. This is where we had breakfast, as the inside of the restaurant is too dark and too cold with A/C in the morning. Some travelers mentioned that the breakfast at Niche was expensive and some opted to go to Kasaltaâ€™s, very popular deli with the locals, located on McLeary Street, about 5- 10 minute walk. We were actually so surprised to see that the prices were very reasonable for the hotel breakfast and the price difference was not much different from Kasaltaâ€™s (except in Kasalta's, the line to order food can get long) . Breakfast at Niche averaged between $5 and maybe $12, very comparable to New York City prices. Blueberry pancakes were excellent, as other travelers mentioned in their reviews. But, my favorite was French toast with strawberry cottage cheese. That was quite amazing. Coffee is excellent and freshly made (it is the equivalent of triple espresso in NYC). You cannot get bad coffee in Puerto Rico. We had breakfast at Niche a few times. But, we also drove to Uvva Restaurant at Hosteria del Mar a few times (this is actually the hotel we were debating to stay). We also loved Uvva Restaurant, as the hotel/restaurant is located directly on the beach and it makes you feel like you are truly on vacation in Caribbean (the price range of the breakfast is very similar to Niche). We did not have breakfast at Kasaltaâ€™s. But ,we went for pastries and coffee and actually bought some pastries to take home with us to New York City. They were fresh and very good. Our only regret was that we didnâ€™t buy more. We had dinner at Niche on our first night. The food here was good, as we experience when we came just for dinner during the summer. Since we woke up very early to travel to San Juan and had not much sleep, we didnâ€™t want to drive to get to other restaurant. The portion at Niche was quite large, as we remembered. So, we ordered two appetizers and shared one entrÃ©e and dessert, and it was more than enough. The restaurant itself for dinner is not very cheap. For the remaining days, we drove to all of our favorite restaurants. Our favorite places, that we never miss when we are in San Juan are Ummo Argentinean Grill (excellent steak), Budatai (We recommend ordering whole bunch of appetizers. We love their foie gras, Hirame with coconut sauce, eel role, Asian style octopus (pulpo) â€“ Puerto Rican restaurants really know how to prepare octopus â€“ very tender and never chewy like in Sushi bars), and of course, Pikayo for their excellent food and attentive service (We have been going to Pikayo for years every since the restaurant was located in the Museum. But, they moved to Conrad hotel a while back, which is much easier to get to. They always bring for us our favorite appetizer on the house. Desset not to be missed their cheese soufflÃ© with guava sauce). This time, we also tried Casa Lola, Chef Roberto Trevinoâ€™s newest restaurant and newest addition to Budatai and Bar Gitano, Pamelaâ€™s located at Numero 1 Guest House. We also like Marmalade Restaurant in Old San Juan. But, we did not make it there this time. Casa Lola was very good (particularly fried cheese appetizer with passion fruit sauce and also foie gras). But, the portion was so large. Next time, we will stick to just ordering a few appetizers and no entrÃ©e. We recommend trying these restaurants in San Juan. San Juan is filled with great restaurants. All restaurants mentioned above are in Condado, with exception of Marmalade. I made dinner reservation via Open Table before we left for San Juan. This way, we can accumulate points. By the way, the hotel has wi-fi at the lobby. But, you can also connect, if you are in the balcony area outside of the room. For some reason, my cell phone reception (Verizon) was not very good and I did not get any emails on my blackberry. Maybe this was a sign that I should not be checking any work emails while I was on vacation. However, my boyfriend who had AT&T had good reception. During the day, we simply relaxed at the beach. Compared to other Caribbean islands, we must say that the San Juan beach is not the best (it is quite wavy and does not have the crystal turquoise blue water and white sand). But, the Ocean Park beach is generally pretty (Some places have lots of sea weed and it is a shame that it is not cleaned up) with miles of golden color sand. We took a walk on the beach with our dogs every night. We loved the fact that it is quite safe at night. We did not even think about going to the beach at night when we stayed in Condado. It just did not feel very safe. We saw some oneâ€™s car being broken into during the day time. So, being able to walk around the beach at night was a big plus. It is quite romantic too, with moonlight shining on the water. During the day, especially late afternoon, we were surprised that the beach got quite crowded with young locals. We read somewhere that the Ocean Park beach had increasingly become very popular with young locals. But, compared to the Condado beach, it is still more quiet. The hotel mentioned on our first day that they had four beach chairs available for free, on the first come first served basis (they are kept around the front desk area). However, we only saw two, one of which was broken, for the first couple of days, and after that none. So, you have the option of laying on the beach towels (the hotel supplies you with the beach towels but they are not very big) and use a very tiny beach chair if you are lucky enough to find it (it is probably not very comfortable if you are not built small). What we did while we stayed at Acacia was walk over to Numero 1 Guest House. They are located directly on the Ocean Park beach. You can get to the beach first and walk along the beach for about 5 minutes. If you order drinks, or say you will be ordering lunch from their restaurant, Pamelaâ€™s, the hotel staff will hook you up with nice comfy beach chairs (i.e., real beach chairs), beach table, and umbrella for free. So, this is what we did every day pretty much. We tip the hotel staff between $5 and $7 for providing a great service to us. When we had dinner at Pamelaâ€™s for dinner, we were not that impressed. Perhaps, we did not order the right dishes. But, we loved having lunch there (their menu for lunch was pretty much the same as dinner menu except for sandwiches). We loved the scallop ceviche, curry crab salad, and pulled pork sandwich with plantains. However, the food here is quite expensive. Sandwiches ran about $18. But, since they are humongous, if you split with another person, it will be more than enough. Nevertheless, we loved the convenience of having the lunch/drink service and being able to relax and be comfortable at the beach, rather than sitting on our towes or using a very tiny beach chair that the hotel offered. Also, the area around Numero 1 Guest House stayed sunnier a lot later than the area near Acacia, as there are no tall buildings to block the sun. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at Acacia and no major complaints. The hotel room was clean, and comfortable despite the size, and in good safe location, just a block away from the beach, with very friendly staff at the front desk. So, if you are looking for a large hotel experience with lots of restaurants, big swimming pool (Acacia has no swimming pool, although you can use the pool at At Wind Chime Inn. We looked at it and it is a tiny pool), and be right on the beach, this is definitely not the place for you. But, if you are looking for a very intimate hotel experience (we personally like these intimate hotels, as we live in the high-rise building in mid-town, Manhattan), we would recommend this hotel, although next time around we would love to stay at the hotel, that is located right on the beach, where we can hear the waves.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Debsvlad
Reviews.Content: Thank you to my gf who researched and found La Concha! My husband and I spent one night here before boarding our cruise ship. Lovely boutique hotel with a restaurant (Niche) which in my opinion served one of the best meals I have ever had. Our room was steps away from the largest hot tub in P.R. Where we enjoyed a cocktail after dinner and chilled after a long day of travel. The director and staff were most accommodating. Definitely worth a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: JenSpot
Reviews.Content: When first I set eyes on the Boutique, I was skeptical. Its laid back ambiance and its small character were unnerving at first. After a few minutes with the host and a few minutes to visit, those fears were quickly alleviated. We're into boutique places and this is one of the nicest we've visited. The rooms are comfortable and spacious but not ostentatious. All the features work as advertised. Another plus is the restaurant, the Niche. the food is classy and delicious, and the ambience is intimate yet sociable. As for comfort, the hotel beds are spacious and comfortable. The location is great...15min cab ride from the Old Town and a 2 minute(literally) walk from the beach. If you're staying in San Juan, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A real find on Condado”
Reviews.Author: laughinghusky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only one night due to a long plane overlay. I had read about this on Trip Advisor and decided to stay because it was not too far from the airport and yet it was very close to Condado Beach....Actually, it is one building from the beach....about 75 steps....It was 2 private houses that were redesigned and renovated as a boutique hotel...It does not have many rooms and they are decorated in Spanish style. Lots of tile, lots of Terra Cotta. The lobby is small and very attractive. There is an adjoining restaurant....The Niche....which I also reviewed which was one of the best restaurants on the island. Also very small and intimate. The management goes out of the way to help you. There are no elevators so if there is a mobility disability, that could be a problem. I am not sure if there are first floor rooms. Our room had a balcony overlooking the gem of a hot tub...or maybe I should say small pool with lots of jets....Extremely attractive and wonderful to sit it, especially after a long plane ride. Can't say enough good things about this place....It is the antithesis to Hyatt's and Hilton's....I do not have anything against them.... but sometimes it is so wonderful to stay in a place that you feel that you came home...except it has a chef and beach a few steps away...There is also a bit larger sister hotel about 1=3 blocks away but I did not see it except from the outside. It is about $18-20 ride from the airport, not counting tip.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: redsea100
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this lovely hotel for two nights after our caribbean cruise. we selected it because of its great reviews from fellow trip advisors and we were not disappointed. Our room had two kingsized beds, a 45 inch flat screen tv and we stepped out of it straight into the balcony jacuzzi. The beach was just down the street and if you were happy to walk for 20 mins there are several resturantes, shops and a couple of food stores.We had a meal in the hotel resturante which was expensive but lovely. I had a problem with the hairdrier - someone had put a sticker over the on button!! but a quick trip down to reception and a man that can came and sorted it for me. Our flight home was late afternoon, the hotel stored our luggage, had a bathroom with shower which we could use and phoned a taxi for us. This hotel does what it says on the tin!! An individual boutique with friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “nice but far from condado center”
Reviews.Author: GeniGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 4 nights in our trip around Puerto Rico Island. The hotel, even in general, is nice; there are some things I didn't like too much... It's quite far from the "center" of Condado, it takes more than a 1/2 hours walking to get to the Ashford part where are the bars, restaurants and shops. So for people who likes walking and going around by food, as we are, the hotel it's a little far from center places. The rooms were really very very small. It is true we asked for "the cheapest ones" but, any way where too small for the price we paid, and comparing to the rest of hotels we also stayed in. The bed wasn't even queen size...I think was even smaller!. The good things... it is really close to the beach, only few meters from... And some of the staff members are really nice and helpful, but not all of them...

Reviews.Title: “The very definition of a boutique hotel ... what a gem!”
Reviews.Author: SEKinney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Acacia for 3 nights for our first trip to Puerto Rico. This place is gorgeous! Spanish architecture with multi-levels and walkways between rooms. The director and all of the other staff were so accommodating. They help with anything you need (cabs, places to go, etc) and are on a first name basis. Our king room was a perfect size with a large tv and private bath (all of them have private bathes) and the bed was comfy with soft, light linens. We read reviews about kings being two twins stuck together, but that was not the case. Our room had a private back balcony, but many of them had front balconies overlooking the HUGE hot tub. The tub is amazing to say the least. It's the largest one in San Juan with jets everywhere and two waterfalls. The view from the pool and most balconies is a partial oceanview. The tall tower The hotel is so close to the beach, which is great for walking back easily. Pamela's on the beach is just east (a 10 minute beach walk) where you can eat in the sand. They have outdoor showers to rinse off, towels and cucumber/fruit water available in the lobby, and on the ground level is this delicious restaurant called Niche ... let's just say the food is unbelievable. Best meal in San Juan. Some tips to note to travelers: this is not a cookie cutter resort with all of the amenities. What you get with this place is a cozy, comfy little getaway. It is on the east end of Condado, so a bit away from the happening bars and restaurants and a bit further from Old San Juan. However, its close enough for long walks or short cab rides and is worth the peacefulness, service, food, and beach location! There is a really cool deli (Kasalta - that President Obama visited) and other restaurants to the east that are easy to walk to from Acacia. We highly recommend this place and expect to stay again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet and steps from the beach”
Reviews.Author: Jakevich
Reviews.Content: Acacia provided our home in San Juan for one week, and it couldn't have been nicer. The property itself is cute and cozy, tucked away on a quiet street about 20 meters from the beach. We emailed the hotel early and asked for a partial ocean view (the best they've got, considering an ugly condo splits the view between the balcony and the ocean), and got it--for no extra cost. Excellent idea. Sitting out on the balcony was a joy, whether waking up to the fresh ocean breeze, resting in the hot afternoon, or listening to the coquis (P.R. tree frogs that chirp and chirp and whistle and sing and chirp and chirp...) with a cocktail at night. I believe all the rooms have a balcony, but it was extra nice looking out over the beach and the sea. Everyone at reception was helpful and kind (we ran the gamut, staying 7 nights), whether providing advice or a last-minute rental car. [Speaking of rental cars, go with Target, a P.R. company just across the expressway. They were prompt and competitively priced and easy. Enterprise, with whom we originally made a reservation, failed to show up with our car and then "lost" our reservation.] The staff at Niche, the hotel restaurant, were kind and helpful too. As for Niche, it's expensive, but we enjoyed two meals there anyway. The giant jacuzzi was nice too, but more of a gimmick than anything. Free Wi-Fi worked great on my tablet, and the TV options were just fine with lots of English programming. As for the neighborhood, Condado Beach is gorgeous. Swam every morning and afternoon in the rolling, warm surf (a bit seaweedy at times, but ever so refreshing and fun). Tips: for good local eats, go to Kasalta (left a few blocks on McLeary www.kasalta.com), Santurce BBQ (a great little joint on Degetau off McLeary), Tijuana's (great Mexican food in the frou-frou area right on Ashford), or Bebo's for mofongo (but little else: poor service & atmosphere). Mofongo is a must eat while in P.R. Coffee is good and cheap at Cafe del Loto just left on Loaiza, or at Kasalta. The SuperMax grocery store on de Deigo provided us with plenty of water, DonQ Rum, snacks, etc., to keep up happy while in the room. The 53 and 21 buses run down Ashford to Old San Juan (the gem of the city). The fare is 75 cents (bring quarters), board them at the 'parada' stops. Easy and cheap way to get to Old San Juan (taxis are much much too expensive). Note: the 53 and 21 buses stop running at 9pm, but you can still get back on the 1 (? not sure of the number, but ask how to get to the east end of Condado), which takes you just a few blocks from Ashford. Took the ferry from Old San Juan (50 cents) to Contano for the Bacardi Rum tour, which was fun. Can't say enough about how lovely Old San Juan is. Just soak it all in... Other advice? Rented the car from Target for 2 days; went to Caguas for a baseball game (awesome) and El Yunque to hike the rainforest (also awesome, a must do). Driving was typical of driving anywhere, and it was easy to navigate. Parked on Taft in front of the hotel both nights for free. [Technically there's no parking allowed, but everyone parks there anyway. Tip: park on the Acacia side of the street. If the unlikely happens and tickets are handed out, the fine is much lower on that side.] It was a $20 cab ride to and from the airport, but well worth it. There's really no other option, anyway. Don't forget to get Duty Free on your way out of P.R. It doesn't matter that you're still in the United States. What else? Have fun, say hi to the coquis, and say gracias, adios! on your way out.

Reviews.Title: “Claudio!”
Reviews.Author: Jasanne B
Reviews.Content: Although I was happy with the place, it was the people who made our stay at the Acacia enjoyable and memorable. Claudio, the morning front desk manager, was an incredibly friendly, tentative, resourceful staff member who went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. He arranged for me to take a bio bay kayaking tour with a reputable company. The experience was one I'll never forget and I thank him immensely for the suggestion and arrangement. He was informative and kind and took the time to talk to us: we learned a lot about Puerto Rican culture from what he shared with us. (Charlene, Chad, and even the Chef were also very nice and helpful!)(There was, however, one front desk clerk in the morning - European accent - who was very rude, didn't seem to understand my English, and seemed put off by my questions which he answered as simply as he could. He misinformed me regarding how long it took to drive somewhere. He was not hospitable!) Being a boutique hotel Acacia is not an appropriate place for children, a great place for couples and friends; however, the staff was very kid-friendly and accommodating to my three year old and me. Claudio was wonderful with my son: he's naturally good with kids. The restaurant was to posh to eat at with my son, but one evening when we didn't want to go out to eat, they made a gourmet pizza and brought it up to the fourth floor roof deck for us to have dinner. It was perfect! My son had ample space to eat and move around and we didn't have to worry about bothering any nearby couples out for a romantic dinner. We could hear the ocean waves, count the stars, and listen to the "coqui" frogs. Because I dislike large cookie-cutter hotel chains, casinos, franchise resturaunts, and loud clubs, this hotel was perfect. It had personality: friendly staff, cool chill-out music, refreshing cucumber/orange water at the front desk, residential location... It wasn't directly on the beach, but one apartment building away from the beach. (Maybe 13 steps from the hotel to the sand?) You can see the beach from the Jacuzzi on the second floor and the roof deck on the fourth floor. The beach is clean, quiet, spacious, peaceful, not crowded... The water, bathwater warm, was a bit rough to swim in. I saw some incredible rainbows. Palm trees with coconuts. Early in the morning you'll see a personal trainer working out 2 or 3 local people. If I had stayed longer, I would have liked to have found out about his fee and tried to sign up: it actually looked like fun and not work. He had some very creative ways of getting people in shape. (There's also a local yoga studio close by.). I have to suggest two local places to eat, walking distance to the hotel that my family and I enjoyed. One was a local place called Cafe Bebos: a clean, family-friendly, restaurant with good, fast service, informative servers and typical puerto-rican food. The second place is a bakery with good coffee called Kasalta. In the morning you'll find all the locals gathered around drinking coffee, eating breakfast, reading the newspaper, and engaged in lively conversation. In the evening this turns into a place were people eat dinner with a bottle of wine. A couple of blocks from the hotel I came across a local shop that makes custom-made bathing suits and bikinis. For $45 dollars I had a custom-made bikini made for me and they did it in one day! I wouldn't have come across a place like this in San Juan or in Isla Verde. A couple of suggestions for the hotel: 1. Bathrobes! 2. If possible, window screens (I would love to open the windows at night without having tropical insects fly in.). 3. Update the website: I didn't know there were fridges in the room and was worried about how I would be able to buy and store milk form my son. 4. Update the phone number on the business cards. 5. Put a couple of chairs and small tables on the roof deck for a place to have breakfast. 6. A tour of the hotel at check-in: I didn't know there was an outdoor shower for rinsing off from the beach until a couple of days into my stay. 7. (Tourist) maps of the island

Reviews.Title: “looks better then it is”
Reviews.Author: candegurrl25
Reviews.Content: Our biggest problem was they said they didn't have my booking. Even though i had a printout of my booking reservation. After much confusion they gave us a room. Later they told me they found what they though was our booking and charged my cc 575$ When i left they charged me the room rate and told me all would be fixed. I get home and check my cc bill and there are of course 2 charges . Now i am trying to get that money back and of course the hotel says they have no record of the 2nd charge. Room was nice, spa is miniature. Close to beach and in the middle of a okay area. You can walk to some cool places down the road and its safe at night.They need to get their bookings and charges in order. Why they would charge me 575$ when i was only booked for one night at a rate of 176$ is beyond me. I have spoken to 4 people so far and still it hasn't been fixed. Stay at you own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...”
Reviews.Author: sceneMT
Reviews.Content: My review is a little late, we traveled in early Augusust of 11'. I felt the need to review: Upon our arrival here, we were treated soooo rudely by the lady at the front desk. We think it's because when we first arrived we were drenched from the rain forest and in hiking clothes. It's NOT ok. We arrived in the early evening and went to check in., we were treated very rudely by the lady at the front desk who was just plain mean. I was appalled and we almost left right there. Unfortunately I had already paid for my room. She was the most unprofessional person I encountered on my trip to Puerto Rico. She acted as though we werent good enough to be staying there and when I asked where I could park my car she told me they didn't have any parking. Luckily, I had printed out my confirmation email stating I had requested and paid for the parking. She eventually reluctantly 'found' us a spot. When we went over to the sister hotel to park our car, they were expecting us. Our car was the ONLY one there for the next two days. Out of parking huh? If I were her boss and whitnessed that, I would have fired her on the spot (my boyfriend and I are both attorneys in the U.S. and love how she judged us by our gym clothes). She seemed to warm up a little bit after we had showered and changed into clothes for 'going out'. Seems as though she would know better. The next day we were LUCKY enough to have a WONDERFUL host. If it were not for this man (who's name I cannot remember) our stay would have been based on our first impression. We had went to the castillo's that day and ended at pinky's with sammies to go and a bottle of wine. When my boyfriend went to find platic cups he presented us with plastic wine glasses! He was so very nice and let us take them to beach for our dinner and in the hot tub later. He was outstanding! So friendly. The hotel itself: Actually I loved it. The hot tub is very nice, great size, and very peaceful in the morning. you can see the ocean from it while sipping your cucumber water. The beach is literally just down the street, not even a block away. The location was also nice (we had a rental car), it was quick to the busier areas, walk to pinkie's (sooo yummy!) and the rooms were all you need. Small but clean and comfortable. We would stay here again but if the desk receptionist that was rude appeared again, I would happily give her a piece of my mind. Also, we did not have dinner at niche but breakfast, lox are better at pinkies

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: jodamo
Reviews.Content: Good location and value. Close to the beach. Walking distance to restaurants. Feels more like you've rented a flat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel, Gracious Hospitality, Location Can't be Beat”
Reviews.Author: WickerParkBob
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my Haloween birthday at this charming, small boutique hotel (21 rooms). The public spaces are very hip and modern, including their restaurant NICHE. The rooms themselves have a relaxed, hacienda feel, with terra cotta tile showers and floors, ceiling vans, and wicker furniture. Many rooms have private outdoor patios or balconies. There is a roof sundeck, if you're too lazy to go to the beach (50 steps away at the end of the block), and a sparate large (maybe 30x10 feet) heated whirlpool which overlooks the Atlantic. But what I'll remember most is the hospitality of the staff. By the time you leave, you'll feel like part of their family. It was a great value. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars to the staff/owners at Acacia/San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Thomas S
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Acacia late October 2011. Stunningly beautiful hotel feet from the Ocean, with a gourmet restaurant, Niche, and an award winning chef. (Congratulations!!!) The staff at Acacia is very helpful, including the charming Director of Guest Services. The ocean view from the jacuzzi is spectacular, especially with a Chad/Mojito in hand. The rooms overlooking the jacuzzi/Atlantic Ocean are large. The price small in comparison. San Juan is a romantic Caribbean location, a place to wind down and relax, to sit in the sun (love that sundeck overlooking the Ocean, great lounge chairs) take naps, go for walks and eat late (check out the Duck Confit Tacos at Niche) Four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, stay away from the normal chains!”
Reviews.Author: Alissa M
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Saturday before our cruise departed on Sunday night.. It was absolutely beautiful. Do not judge the hotel based on it's surroundings. It is secluded, private and VERY SAFE! This is not a commercial, chain hotel! If you want a place like that with a huge closet and a nice big parking lot then this is not the place for you. The rooms are smaller than a regular hotel room but they are not tiny.. we were in love with this place from the moment we walked in. The hot tub is huge and so nice to relax in, the resturaunt "The Niche" has wonderful food (try the lobster/mango salad app!), the beach is close and clean and the service is better than most 5 star hotels. We were checked in and WALKED to our hotel room and the ammenities were personally pointed out to us. We went on a repelling trip before our cruise and they kept our luggage safe so we didn't have to worry about it during our tour and we went back to the hotel after our cruise to leave our bags there before our flight that night. It was such a joy to see excellent, personal customer service! Also, take my advice on the Don Q Rum!! We purchased one bottle and now have to drive an hour or so to a liquer store to get it!! It is wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Acacia Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jillian K
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel was absolutely beautiful. The lobby was furnished with a contemporary style, with lush plants and bright colors. The room was small, but reasonable for our needs. One complaint about the room was that our bed was not actually a king sized bed, it was actually 2 twin beds pushed together, so there were a few times when we were sleeping that we would start to slip in the crack between the beds. They have a very nice hot tub outside on a balcony and on the roof you can sunbath, but one drawback to that is that both of those are only open until 6, so by the time we got back to the hotel and were ready to get in the hot tub, it was already closed. The staff was super friendly, but when it came to suggesting local restaurants, they weren't a lot of help. Overall, the experience was great. It's only half a block from the beach, which was awesome and the room was kept nice and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WHAT I EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: AAGN1601
Reviews.Content: Ok so I checked in to this hotel two days before leaving on a cruise obviously because they have some great comments on trip advisorâ€¦ First of all Expedia should not advise complimentary parking if the parking belongs to the street, there is no parking and where I parked I had to get up in the middle of my breakfast because I was advised that cops would give me a ticket. The front desk agent that checked me in Javier was really good very friendly guy all thought the check in process took 15 minutes and it was not completed because they could not register me in the hotel. While Iâ€™m waiting for my keys Javier kind of took a very log time to give them to me the night chef of the hotel Christian in a very friendly but awkward way was teaching me how to say curse words in Spanish (what is that). The rooms are pretty big but have no closet so just throw your clothing around, the room dÃ©cor is a twilight zone feeling Old, modern, Old, modern I didnâ€™t get it. The bathroom was sort of a rustic Mexican, mosaic broken tile type of dÃ©cor not bad but considering that there was more cement and grout than tile kind of makes you wonder if you should go in there with your shoes on because of sanitary issues I mean people pee in bathrooms and women have there periods once a month so that for me is kind of weird. The front desk Wilfredo forgot my wake up call and by the time they saw me pass trough the front desk they said â€œyeah I was just about to call youâ€� really 45 minutes late thanks dude. To my great disappointment, I mean this hotel has reviews the only the New York times writers would write Iâ€™m expecting to be blown a way by these peoples service form the minute I walk in to the minute I leave but no nothing like the reviews, a well kept property but nothing like the reviews. So to all those â€œTimes Magazineâ€� reporter like â€œWOW head over heals Iâ€™m dead if I donâ€™t stay at this property again reviewersâ€� thanks for fooling me.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: NTXAV8R
Reviews.Content: From the day we arrived, we knew something was different with this hotel! The wait staff was absolutely amazing! Ed at the front desk was the most accommodating hotel clerk/front desk manager guy I have EVER experienced. He would open the door for us, grab a fresh towel as we came off the beach with wet towels, make recommendations on where to go and what to do and what to eat! By far the best hotel experience we have ever had! The hotel was quaint, the room size was PERFECT and romantic....COLD AC, ceiling fans, ocean and jacuzzi views!! (room 202 - an awesome room!) The details in the bathroom were awesome! Great tile work! Israel in Niche's (in the hotel) restaurant was great! Charlene was amazing - a true gem of a teammate on this team that delivered FAR more than we expected! The hotel has AMAZING architecture and views...the top floor is for sun bathing and catching the ocean breeze and views! Stay here over the big hotel chains...YOU WON'T be disappointed!! I'd give this place/staff/experience a 10 STAR if Trip-advisor gave me the option!!! Kudos to everyone at Acacia for making our stay so memorable! Thank you for all you did while we stayed there!! You guys are the best! Spencer & Kris

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Retreat - Impeccable Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kek131
Reviews.Content: You wake up one day and decide to take a trip to Puerto Rico. You surf the internet - you read the reviews - and think " Well if it is even 75% as good as the reviews, it should be ok".... Well, I can tell you first hand that the Acacia Seaside Inn is everything I read about and more. The staff - Brenda, Freddy - were so helpful in assisting us with our day trip plans. Brenda's suggestion of a day trip to Vieques to do the Bio-Kayak tour was incredible. She said it was "the best" and it was. I fell in love with Vieques Island and the sister property - Inn on the Blue Horizon. Brenda gave us directions for every phase of the trip, from the transportation to the ferry to setting up the Kayak and snorkeling tours for us. Our room on the second level, adjacent to the hot-tub made for some very relaxing evenings after dinner. The Inn is immaculate - from the entry lobby to our room. The hot tub and surrounding area was washed down everyday as well as all tile areas around the Inn. Our room with two double beds was very spacious. Now, let's talk about getting around. The Inn is located in Condado, and we walked almost everywhere. Very safe, as there was always lots of activity and great police presence. When we needed a taxi, the front desk called and it was never more than 4 mintues until the taxi arrived. And of course, the beach is 1/2 block down the street from the Inn and clean and beautiful. We walked down Ashford to shopping, casinos, restaurants and the lovely gem of a spa - Euphoria. If you want the BEST food in San Juan - JUST STAY AT THE ACACIA AND DINE AT - NICHE!!!! We had our breakfast daily of the most lovely fresh fruit and coffee. Dinner - served by the most lovely Donna, was incredible...... Lobster soaked in vanilla and pumpkin risotto.......beef that melts in your mouth.......asparagus/mushroom risotto...... Believe me when I say they are there to take care of you. The wine list was very reasonable and had great selection. And did I mention the LOVELY DONNA????? If you are looking for loud noise, bustling activity, impersonal service, and cookie cutter environment then this is not the place.......BUT should you want to spend your vacation with a wonderful group of people, in a relaxing, clean, well appointed Inn that has access to all the "night-life" if you choose, and great hot tub if you don't, then please make a reservation for the Acacia - you will not be sorry. PS: We stayed for 8 nights - so we really got to know the staff and the Inn.....they never changed - from check-in to check-out it was a wonderful choice for my first week long vacation since 2007!

Reviews.Title: “A”
Reviews.Author: doris l
Reviews.Content: My son and I recently stayed in this quiet little gem hidden on a quiet street in Condado. Ahhhh, is what I found myself saying each time we walked into the cozy lobby and welcoming staff. I could have stayed forever as I felt so welcomed by Brenda, the general manager. She went above and beyond to help make my travel plans on the island go smoothly. The rooms are beautifully appointed, and feel very homey, tropical style. With the beach a few steps away, it had it all for me!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Cruzpino
Reviews.Content: Honestly we were on a budget and did not think we could afford to stay there but so glad we did. I have never been treated so well by a staff that made us feel like we had been friends forever. The first reviews I wrote somehow got lost in cyberspace...but even now I recall their names and smiling faces and I am not good with names. So...say hi to Chad, Donna, Chef Christian and the rest of their fantastic staff for us when you get there :) I will be writing a separate review of their phenomenal restaurant so I will try and focus on the hotel, best jacuzzi we had ever seen, all in all an unexpected pleasure of an experience that helped make it our best trip ever. Rooms were quaint and authentic. It is NOT your typical hotel so you need to manage your expectations - no elevator...get over it. It's worth it. We WILL be back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service @ This Tastefully Tucked San Juan Oceanblock Gem”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra B
Reviews.Content: In the sea of standard San Juan hotels, the Acacia is a truly discreet, boutique beachblock hideaway. Just one block away from the Ocean Park beach, their lush, tropical lobby is always good to come to, with fresh cucumber or tropical fruit water waiting. NichÃ© restaurant is this super chic-romantic little spot, and a lobster risotto that's to die for - not to mention homemade coconut milk PiÃ±a Coladas with fresh pineapple! Meander up the staircase at happy hour to toast your vacay - and a blushing San Juan sunset (I miss them). Last but not least, who could forget the manager with a grin that spans the ocean! Great service here by Chad! The rooms are smallish, could use a redÃ©cor, but what you're choosing is a stylish yet affordable clean boutique spot, in a super safe walkable Condado/Ocean Park neighborhood - right by the beach.

Reviews.Title: “COZY, ROMANTIC GETAWAY SPOT”
Reviews.Author: sandsurfnsea
Reviews.Content: Acacia is a solid three stars hotel nothing more, nothing less. the location is perfect for a romantic getaway just off the main strip and right on the beach. the food and entertainment is 10mins walk down Ashford st. You get the feeling that you are at home away from home here.The staff is extremely helpful and friendly and generally stays out of your way. the front desk staff is quite knowledgeable about the local food spots and tours don't hesitate to ask.(TIP if you have to take the bus to Old San Juan, its only 75cents exact change, make a right on ashford and walk to the bus stop in front of the Hospital there you can get the 21 and 53) Back to the hotel, the room is small but adequate try to get one of the ocean view with a balcony the ocean breeze is wonderful. the hotel doesn't have an elevator so factor that into your plans when booking a room. They are very lenient with their check-in times. and would allow you to use the shower and hot tub after check out. This is a beautiful little property that is doing everything just right, just don't expect a ton of amenities like the big resorts. what you get here is personalized service and a good place to launch your exploration of San Juan and Old San Juan. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them and look forward to staying there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gregwc1
Reviews.Content: Great location, just a couple minutes from a beautiful beach, about 15 minute walk from shopping area and starbucks..room was small but very clean, not much of a view from the balcony, plus no furniture on the balcony.very nice jacuzzi . They have a sister hotel down the street I didn't get to visit. The restaurant on premises is very good...would stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Far below expectations”
Reviews.Author: gadi_sam
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Acacia Boutique Hotel, San Juan, in August 2011, before our cruise, and were greatly disappointed. First of all, the rooms are VERY tiny. There was hardly space to put our luggage. Second, they have no elevator, so we had to carry our luggage up in the stairs. More shortcomings: - The shower was one of the worst I've ever seen, if not THE worst. - They charge you $5 per hour for arrival after 10pm! I've never heard such a thing in my life! - We asked to check-out a little bit later than 11am, but they insisted on a $20 fine per hour on late check-out... - If you need the front desk at 7am - there's nobody to talk to. - There's no coffee shop nearby to have breakfast, the closest one is Starbucks, which is about 10 minutes walk from the hotel. - In their ads they say they have a jacuzzi-spa with 18 water jets and a heating system. Actually, the water temperature is far from being hot, and the water jets are ordinary taps... The only good thing was the free Wi-Fi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Acacia inside and out~You have to stay!”
Reviews.Author: danxtsupamodel
Reviews.Content: Thanks TripAdvisor & Acacia Staff! My husband and I celebrated our 5 year wedding anniversary @ Acacia on last Friday. We actually just left on Wednesday 8/17/11 and really wanted to stay longer but we will be back with family and friends! So how did I find out about Acacia? I read about how great this hotel was on TripAdvisor and my husband agreed that we should stay so I booked our stay and off we were to San Juan. So the hotel~ 1st Impressions are always lasting! We took a Taxi due to finding out you can take the local bus for 75 cents basically all over the island and that there were a little more than 3 stops within a 5-10min walk from the hotel. So we stepped out of the Taxi right in front of Acacia's huge wooden door and heard wonderul relaxing music as well as the ocean's waves and people playing volleyball on the beach of course. Besides the door we noticed that the beach was right there~I mean you step outside and you see the water,waves, sand ,trees etc! So that of course was a plus in our book! So we are buzzed in because your room key is the key that allows you to open the door to the hotel and we were greeted by Beth!
