I'm so bad with names but as soon as we opened the door she greeted us with a huge smile and said "GoodMorning welcome to Acacia!' We were so in awe of the lobby we just looked around and took in the lovely colors,smells, music and of course the HUGE REAL plants they have all over! She let us know that her system was down and that our room would be ready in about 5min. Our flight got in real early and we didn't request an early check in...we just got off the plane and headed right for the hotel. Okay so now we are calm and very relaxed and she say's we have fresh apple,lemon, and melon water if you would like to try some! Oh my goodness~It was AWESOME! Maybe because I was thirsty or something but it was the best! So we drank 2 cups each just standing there it was ICE COLD! Another plus! So now she say's let me give you a tour of our property~my husband and I are like okay sure~she not only takes us to our room but show's us everything about the property, the resturant-which I will come back to, the jacuzzi, the sundeck, the sister property 1 street over at the corner, and of course the beach! My hubby and I felt like were staying with family! So after showing us all over this wonderful place she tells us about the local festivals they were having in Old San Juan and how to get there, local places to eat, what shops were close by to get great gifts...I mean she was so full of energy and information! We got maps from her and she circled everything and even outlined things for us! What a great first impression! So after reading all the reviews on TripAdvisor I asked if Chad was around since so many people raved about how helpful he was~well Chad was having major back issues and was going to be out the entire time we were there :( Hope your better Chad! So with that being said she let us know that she would be there until 10pm and if we needed anything she was just a call away. So our room~Our room # was 204 so we were on the second floor. We had a pefect view of the beach and the jacuzzi! Our bed was a queen and it was quite comfy! We had a flat screen tv and everything we needed. The only thing I had an issue with was our curtain rod was a bit dusty and it didn't close like I wanted it to. You couldn't see in from the balcony but there was still a bit of light just shinning in. My husband had no issues with it so I didn't bother with bringing it up to the front desk or the maid during our stay. Room 204 had no tub....I really didn't care but some other's might. I believe none of the rooms have tub's but don't hold me to that. The shower has this really cool stone back and floor~actually it runs throughout the entire bath room! We loved it up until we came back from the beach and still had some sand on our flip flops and clothing and it would get wet and then be on the floor. Not a huge deal! So let's see the sheets and pillows smelled nice and fresh each day. The room was cleaned by the same lady everyday. I actually think she's the only cleaning lady they have~she was the only one we saw our entire stay and she was very friendly and made sure we always had everything we needed. The Jacuzzi-This thing is AWESOME! It was well kept! Always clean, and hot! My husband and I sat in it daily and they have a small area that you can wash yourself off that's beside the jacuzzi. Keep in mind it's in the open and there are at least 4-5 high rises that are by the hotel so don't be alarmed if you see people staring at you or sitting on there balcony while you are in the jacuzzi. It closes at I believe 9pm but we were told that you can use it as long as you aren't being loud or bothering the other guest. They make this known because there are outside rooms that you have to walk past to get to the jacuzzi and those that are in those rooms can walk right out of there door and they are steps away from the jacuzzi. We had cups of the apple water sitting on the small bench that's located right outside of the jacuzzi and we never say anyone with drinks or food outside that area. There is no pool! We didn't really care because the beach was right there and who needs a pool when there's a beach right outside your door. We were made aware that guest of Acacia can use the pool at WindChimes which is the sister hotel right up the street. You can actually see it when you walk out of Acacia. It's at the corner. The Resturant-Niche It's very nice and small...I would have to say it seats maybe 20 if that. But it's really neat how it's situated in the back area of the hotel! You have to pass through the front lobby to get to the resturant. They are open for breakfast and dinner. And our waiter-forgot his name was really nice. He had been working there for 4 months and we asked him the basic's since we were the only guest in the resturant at the time-what are some good places to go, what's great to eat at the resturant, where's good shopping etc. He was very nice and helpful. Now, the resturant is not CHEAP! This resturant is about $$$ if you ask me. My husband and I wanted breakfast and didn't want to walk anywhere or take a taxi so we dined at Niche and had the blueberry pancakes and sausage. We paid $14 for breakfast for 1. He recieved 3 nice size pancakes and about 3 sausage links. I thought that was sorta expensive but we shared it and went back to our room. Pancakes had real blueberries in them...they were great! And the sausage links were great as well. Another bonus! Lobby/Reception Area- The owner's have 3 other properties from what I was told. so they switch there employee's around to different properties. The 3 people that were of help to us were Beth,Fred & and I have no idea what the guy's name is but he reminded me of Micheal McDonald. All were very nice and helped with whatever we needed whether is was a Taxi or directions or suggestions. The lobby was always clean and smelled exceptional. There was always jazz or carribean music playing and Ice cold melon & lemon water wating for guests. They also let us know that the weather changes alot but they of course are use to it so it could be sunny and then they have a rain spurt here and there. They had umbrellas for there guest to borrow. They also had beach towels at the front desk. And if you wanted they had snacks and bottle service of DonQ liquors available for I believe $10. All of this was convient if you didn't want to shop outside of the hotel for your alcohol needs. Taxi Service- Lighting fast...The Micheal McDonald looking guy (I'm so sorry I don't remember his name) called us a Taxi. We got our bags and came down stairs and a Taxi was right there! In front of the hotel waiting for us! The Taxi driver's are very nice and accomodating. They have zones so there's no thrown out there price. They have no meters they have Zones 1-4. They have the Zones right on there windows so you can clearly see what the price is before you get into the Taxi. We tipped $2 per bag but they aren't hounding you for tips or anything they are gracious and very nice. So why not rent a car? We didn't rent a car and wouldn't because of the driving conditions. We saw people driving on the side of the road, running through red lights and people double parking there cars and walking off. We chose to just walk and ride the bus. If you ride the bus keep in mind that they just take breaks when they choose and you could be waiting for an hour on a bus. Also, remember you must have exact change if you want to ride the bus. We encountered a driver that wouldn't let this lady ride because she didn't have the exact change. We also asked the driver's where they were going before getting on the bus. Some of the signs were covered due to grafitti and signs and we wanted to make sure we were going the right way. Shopping/Tourist Area Ashford Ave- It's basically within 10min of the hotel. It's the hot spot for tourist. They have bars, clubs, boutiques, resturants, ice cream and of course the Luxury Retail Shops~LV,Gucci, Cartier,Christobal and more. There's a HUGE police presence and you will def feel safe! But once you travel further down Ashford to where the private homes are the Police presence is very minimal. My husband and I felt safe and had no issues walking around the area day or night. We basically always made it back to the hotel by 10pm or 11pm and where fine. Misc. Stuff So the hotel is non smoking but they do have a smoking area that's on the back of the hotel that's very nice. There's bar top tables that are located along a wall and there's lights and candles that are light to keep the bugs away. The ice machine along with the door that leads out of the hotel to the beach are along the back of the hotel as well. You have to use your key to get in and out of these doors. Your room key allows you to open and these doors. There are cameras at both the front and back doors and speaker systems as well. The beach- It's right there! I mean 2min if that from the hotel. It's nice, filled with vendors that are selling fruit and local food. We didn't encounter anyone pushy or that we thought was of any harm. I think I covered everything I could think of...don't take my word for it~try it for yourself Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Doe22us
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Acacia from the 11th-15th and it was fantastic. Conveniently located by the beach, with a wonderful Jacuzi and extremely helpful staff I plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Every room is different”
Reviews.Author: Silver2011
Reviews.Content: This is a very good boutique hotel with friendly staff. Note that every room is different, so try to inquire about steps, noisy air conditioning, and strength of WiFi signal..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull experience”
Reviews.Author: KHsundance
Reviews.Content: Very Beautiful, cozy, and comfortable.. Perfict Place to relax, very short walk to a fabulous beach..And a few blocks to down town San Juan .. Complimentary Beach and Jacuzzi towels..Delicious and refreshing Cucumber and fruit water..Rooms were perfectly elegant and sexy feel .. Would deffinitly return and recommend.. Chad the manager was very friendly and accommodating. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Was very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Naveron
Reviews.Content: We ended up here due to travel plan interruptions related to Tropical Storm Emily. We had not heard of this hotel and did not know what to expect. We were very pleasantly surprised at how stylish and comfortable it was. It's on the beach and within walking distance of shops and restaurants in Condado. The staff were very friendly. It's a small property so there is a very attractive hot tub and a roof top area for sun lounging. You can use the pool at their sister property across the street. The restaurant Niche was excellent. Although our room was one the small side, it was adorable. I would stay here again if I needed a place for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, super-friendly staff, and amazing restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: Edeni2010
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the Acacia, I felt welcomed and relaxed! The beautiful decor made me feel like I was escaping away from the ordinary, everyday experience. After being greeted by Chad, the incredible manager of guest services, we knew that whatever needs we would have while at the Acacia, they would be met. I have never had the desire to "hang out" at any hotel where I have stayed on vacation.... until the Acacia!! Great location, top-notch service, out of this world food, and all the comforts of home! Wishing I was there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: acderrick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel July 9-16 and loved it! We love that it was so close to the beach and the staff always gave great recommendations on where to go for food, activities, etc. They almost become like your friends on this trip since there are only 21 rooms and everyone kind of gets to know everyone. The jacuzzi - 5 stars just for that! We're not usually pool/jacuzzi people (we prefer the beach!) but this HUGE jacuzzi was amazing to come home to every night and enjoy a nice beverage and conversation before bed time. Even though it is a boutique hotel with a romantic feel for couples, I would highly recommend it for single people traveling with a group of friends since there is plenty of nightlife and things to do around the area. Oh - did I mention the restaurant??? AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I will write a seperate review for that later!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jl_williams1
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was very quaint and just steps away from the beach! It wasn't too much pedestrian or tourist traffic, and it really felt as if the hotel was strictly for you. The staff was very helpful! Chad told us about so many great places to go.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure in the heart of Condado Beach”
Reviews.Author: hiramruiz
Reviews.Content: Excellent!!!!' Had a great time. Food superb, service 5 stars. Chad knows how to take care of everything. Great Chef, Dana rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: viajerosma
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a smaller and more intimate guesthouse with personalized service, this is a wonderful alternative to the larger resort-style hotels in the San Juan area. Less than a block away from a relatively uncrowded beach, Acacia is ideally located in a calmer section of Condado and within easy walking distance from the major hotels and restaurants. We appreciated the distance from the more hectic downtown Condado area. Although rooms are not large, they are comfortable and the balconies that face the beach are large and offer great views! The jacuzzi, as described, is huge and a great way to relax after a day at the beach. The ambiance is great, very chic, and the staff is amazingly friendly and personable - they make the hotel. Brenda in reception is extremely helpful and friendly and Donna in the restaurant cannot be beat! We had a great experience and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Chic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snoozenkaye
Reviews.Content: Whoever designed this place did a wonderful job. It is so classy. We were welcomed like visiting friends. I really appreciated the way that Chad greeted me and showed me around- I noticed this at their sister hotel in Vieques- Inn on the Blue Horizon also. They welcome you like one welcomes someone to their home- "here are the beach towels, here is the vegetable infused water for you, here is the jacuzzi, here is the restaurant, here are the menus, we have some yummy fruit infused vodkas that the chef made...". I loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jeremiahOhio
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a wonderful time in Puerto Rico. We went the beginning of June and it rained most of the time we were there, but it was on and off. Our stay at Acacia was really nice and itâ€™s really close to the beach. Service was great, Chad and Brenda were very helpful and they made the stay even better. I would recommend renting a car because you can see a lot more of the island and itâ€™s a lot cheaper than getting a taxi. If you plan on visiting the Bio Bay on the island of Vieques, Acacia has a sister hotel named the â€œInn on the Blue Horizonâ€� it was amazingly beautiful! Just ask Brenda about it, she called them and even set up the kayaking trip for us. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “MESMERIZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: lucyflirt69
Reviews.Content: Acacia Boutique Hotel has been so far one of the best experience of our lives. Everything was beyond espectations, Mr. Siegel attention to details was simply perfect. He made our stay ten times better than in other hotels we've stayed before, and this includes the san juan Marrot and the Ritz Carlton. He took care of our needs with passion and commitment. Our room was very comfortable and cozy. His suggestions for breakfast and dinner were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Socks have been completely knocked off, Im barefoot and hooked”
Reviews.Author: vampino
Reviews.Content: I found Acacia sort of by accident. I have to say, I didn't read any reviews. I needed a hotel quick because I had an impromptu visit to San Juan. So, I booked the Wind-Chime from my phone the morning of my arrival from Vieques ( where I was vacationing from DC ). I had no idea what to expect, but the price was great and I hate big resort hotels that bubble you away from the real deal. I only planned to stay a couple of days to visit friends stopping via cruise and to see Old San Juan. The Wind-Chime is charmingly beautiful and Lourdes is a saint, just what I was looking for. She informed me of the restaurant at their sister hotel, Acacia Boutique Hotel, in case I needed a great meal. The next early-mid afternoon, I wander over to Acacia to check out the grub. I love the beautiful spanish architecture and that the beach is within spitting distance. The lobby speaks for itself, just right, they've thought of everything (I want that scent for my pad you guys!), and I meet Brenda and Chad. Professional and laid back, attentive and not pushy ( and hotties to boot...), I am treated with respect and courtesy. I am too early for the dinner run, so Chad makes a few recommendations, the first being "Miro" (Go!!). It's just a short walk to downtown Condado. On my way out, I wonder if I can change hotels. The process is a snap and Chad gives me a tour of the property. The Buddha is cool and the hot-tub is a show-stopper (wow!). I'm given a room on the third floor that is exceptionally clean and fresh and it has a wrap around balcony facing the ocean. The bed is comfy and I sleep like the dead. Long story short, I spent a week at Acacia, far longer than the couple of days I had planned. Due to my escapades, I regretfully never made it to eat at Niche, the hotels famed intimate restaurant. I will when I come back! The food smelled amazing! I did, however, get to experience their signature Mojito there. I love mojito's and you have to go to Cuba to get one better. The bartender was super friendly and we shared good conversation with the other hotel guests. I did do the hot-tub, thank God, and you can do laps in it! Thank you to Chad and Brenda for helping to make my first time visit to San Juan so memorable. It was the most fun and the best experience I have had in a long time. Not only do you rock, but I feel that I've made new friends as well. You'd be crazy not to stay here, it's the real deal.

Reviews.Title: “HEAVEN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ruthieaframe
Reviews.Content: When my best friend and I decided to go away to celebrate some major life achievements she didn't hesitate when picking a place. "Acacia is the spot" she declared with excitement. She had already been there and knew for sure it would be a magical escape for both of us. Decorated with gorgeous little treasures, Acacia is a delightful gem in the heart of my new favorite place to visit! From the small details of the deliciously iced fruit laden water at the front desk to the major attributes of excellent staff, Acacia is the perfect place to get away and have the experience of a lifetime. Being stashed away in a nook of the city makes you feel at peace with calmness, but the ideal location allows you full access to the wonders of Puerto Rico. Most importantly, it is not about where you are, but who are with and the staff at Acacia truly made our experience spectacular. Chad, the director of guest services, really takes the time to get to know the guests and made sure our stay was as magical as possible. The hotel runs with extreme smoothness and it is clear that Chad and the Executive Chef, Christian Alejandro are responsible for this. Donna and Ian work in the absolutely stunning and delicious restaurant Niche and offer a delightful presence and impeccable service! Overall, My friend and I had the tine of our lives in Puerto Rico and Acacia is to thank for most of that!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover120
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews have already said it, but it doesn't hurt to add more love! The property was fantastic. The friend I was traveling with was hesitant, because it was a boutique hotel and without the brand name quality that comes with some of the big resorts. But from the moment we walked into the lobby, I loved it (as did my friend). The entire staff was very helpful. They were always able to suggest a fantastic place to grab lunch or dinner that was off the beaten path and not full of tourists. I only wish we had had more time, because Chad had given us a suggestion of a place to eat lunch, but we just didn't have time to fit everything in. The hotel is literally steps away to the beach. The beach was very quiet in that area too. It was a very short walk to downtown Condado where all the more tourist aimed restaurants were and a bunch of huge resorts and shopping! I had a fantastic stay at Acacia and would love to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “"Really special - go for it"”
Reviews.Author: AAAZurich
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on the enthusiasm I felt in the earlier Tripadvisor reviews - having stayed there I could easily just â€œcut & pasteâ€� the best of them as my review - this hotel is a great choice - very conveniently located (10 minutes by taxi from the airport or from the old city), just a few steps from a long beautiful beach (beach towels provided) and with the really nice clean rooms arranged around the large outdoor hot jacuzzi. Thatâ€™s already a few good good reasons to choose this hotel. Many of the other reviewers mentioned Chad and having met him I can understand why - he was at the desk when we arrived, he was already well familiar with our reservation and was "expecting us" - that's how our visit started and continued throughout. In fact all the staff we met were genuinely friendly and helpful. We did not have the official breakfast but instead we just sat at the bar in the restaurant and had a bowl of fresh fruit with yogurt and a cup of really good Puerto Rican coffee; then just â€œgrab the towelsâ€� and two minutes later you are on the beach. As well as everything else, many of the previous guests wrote about the restaurant Niche and I was especially looking forward to trying it out. Finally, we wined/dined there both nights sampling many of the dishes - mussels, scallops, lobster with risotto, lamb, black truffle fries. Met Christian the executive chef - he came out both nights and spoke to each of his happy diners in turn - all I can say is I wish that restaurant was in Zurich - Iâ€™d love another bowl of those mussels while my friend just recommended the lamb with black truffle fries, the lobster, the risotto and told me not to forget the deserts. Thanks Christian - we really appreciated it. If what is posted above is what you would like to experience in a hotel - then book it, you wonâ€™t be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, eat here before it's booked solid!”
Reviews.Author: lvalenci
Reviews.Content: Boyfriend and I missed a flight home leaving us "stuck" in San Juan on a rainy afternoon. On gut instinct, booked a room at Wind Chimes hotel which was very nice. Crossed the street for just a snack and walked into Niche, a restaurant shared by sister hotel, Acacia. Chad; parter, concierge and all around hospitality guru, walked us past the most amazing Buda (see pic) and into Niche. We can't say enough about Chef Cristian who effortlessly prepared the biggest, most succulent lobster we've ever tasted. Then, coaxed by the granite, nearly lappool-sized jacuzzi we decided to stay. It's a given that the rooms are more than comfortable. We had the best forced layover we could imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Jacuzzi rocked....minutes from anything you need.”
Reviews.Author: chokhandeez2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Acacia while visiting friends in San Juan. Great location, friendly staff, excellent food & drinks. Affordable. Minutes from anything you'll need.

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Boutique Hotel in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: matticulousme
Reviews.Content: This was such a charming little hotel in Condado, and you really couldn't beat the price. It has one of the best locations (super close to the beach, walking distance to a great part of town, all nestled in a very safe, residential area) and is like stepping into a fantastically preserved little Spanish villa. The rooms were simple: small, but just enough for a trip where you should be spending a majority of your day at the beach or in Old San Juan, anyway. They could use a little bit of sprucing up (we had a couple holes in the curtains and the bedspread; walls needed some touching up, etc), but most importantly, it was clean. Hot tub was great, and the pool at the sister resort, At Wind Chimes, was nice, too. It was literally a block away, and again: small, but a good size for a few people. Niche, the hotel restaurant, seemed to be a bit overpriced (especially for Puerto Rico), so we only ate there for breakfast. The food was delicious, though, and all prepared fresh and right in front of you. The only downside might be the fact that having someone at the front desk is somewhat unreliable. We were told someone would be there until midnight, and at 11PM, there was no one there. Then, when it came time to checkout at 8AM, there was still no one there. Any questions or issues can be answered by the sister hotel down the street, but it would be nice if they could have someone around full-time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing staff. A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Erin R
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was nothing but accomodating. Rooms were small but very quaint. Beautiful atmosphere, about 200 feet to the beach and 5-10 minute/$15 cab ride to Old San Juan. About 10-15 min to airport, $25 cab - GREAT location. Staff had great recommendations on where to go. We were always greeted and asked how everything was going. The balcony room we booked (through booking.com) was not available the first night but staff graciously accomodated us with the room the 2nd night. Brunch is a must. Will definitely stay here again if ever visiting San Juan! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to do it again!”
Reviews.Author: MarkoNava
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in a Condado, San Juan corridor and steps from the beach is Acacia, a quaint boutique hotel. Great service, great rate, and a great location. Chad the manager was super. The hot tub just made the late night dip even better, it was the biggest jacuzzi I've been in. It was Great! Hospitable, attentive and knowledgeable Chad and all the staff helped in making this a great vacation for us. This was our first time in PR and I am glad we made the decision to stay at Acacia. Steps from the beach, minutes from Old San Juan, and about a half our from the rain forest. Can't wait to do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Decision Ever”
Reviews.Author: Abba87
Reviews.Content: I can't say how much I loved this hotel!!! I read all the reviews and knew this was the place home away from home... Me and my boyfriend truly did not want to leave. As soon as we got there we were on the hunt for CHad since we had seen him mentioned in previous reviews as well... Let me just say personally that CHAD is freakin AWESOME, he made our stay very enjoyable. Aside from that the hotel is gorgeous, before I did not really think I could like a boutique hotel, but Acacia made me a believer... The bed was soo comfortable, the bathroom was incredible!! Just overall great, and I loved every second of it and will be returning!!

Reviews.Title: “No disappointments here”
Reviews.Author: Sixty2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Acacia prior to a cruise for two nights. I booked it on line and there were no glitches other than the cab driver having a problem finding it but it all worked out. We had a room just off the hot tub and it had pretty much all you needed to have except seating was a problem. There was no chairs in the room and none on the balcony but we were able to secure a bar stool to use. It is only because I have back issues at times and needed to sit. The beach being close was a nice touch but again no chairs to use so we had to settle for a towel. The restaurant was very good. I have never been to San Juan and wasn't sure what to expect for value. The place was very clean, the service very good and I suppose the prices were comparable with other establishments but for $200+ a night I expected to have a least a place to sit. However I do recommend Acacia as the good outweighed the couple glitches.

Reviews.Title: “Rock Star”
Reviews.Author: Tamala143286
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel and the wonderful people who work here. We decided to stay at this hotel simply due to all the reviews found here. I had a hard time believing what I was reading but honestly, its better. It just hard to put into words how GREAT this place is. Its the people who make this place. Yes, its clean. Yes, the location is perfect; we dont like big tourist traps where you get lost in the number of people. Here everyone knows and remembers your name. Rooms are fabulous and how much time do you really spend in the room? Value, incredible!!! Sleep Quality, let me say, I take perscribed meds to help me sleep otherwise I sleep for 4 hours max. I forgot those meds at home and I slept like a baby, full 8 hours!! I saved Service for the end because "ROCK STAR CHAD" is absolutely the greatest!! You can't find another place with an employee like him!! He is 1 in a million and ladies, very good to look at too!! You just let him know the things you're interested in doing and he does the rest. He even had breakfast made for us one EARLY morning and coffee ready and waiting!! His attention to detail is like no other!! You can really tell when someone loves what he does and Chad really does!! It shows!! This place is great for families, couples and girls get aways!! Girls, you wont be sorry when you see Chad laying on the beach! He has a crazy tanning "system" that he does but if you WATCH very "Closely" you can learn a thing or two. At the end of the trip you leave with "friends".

Reviews.Title: “The best kepy secret in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Uri1940
Reviews.Content: From the minut we entered this Boutiue hotel we felt like comming home to be with family and friends. The building is a restored Spanish Villa dated back to the 1920th and it still maintains that eras atmosphere which is casual elegance and relaxing enviroment. The hotel is located in Condado a 10 minuts drive from old San Juan, the beach is 5 minuts walk and there is a sizabel Jacuzzi one can relax in. The Niche restaurant which is in the hotel is the best in the area.General Manager Ms. Rivera and Director of guest services Chand Siegel were very helpful and attended to all of our needs. We highly recommend this place, and we will definitly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Acacia es muy bueno!”
Reviews.Author: blissfulseas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days before a cruise and couldn't have been more pleased! The restaurant was top notch and everyone there made it their personal mission to make your stay as pleasant as possible! Chad was very helpful and went out of his way to guide us to the best spots, and Christian the chef was awesome! The coffee was amazing and everything I ordered there was absolutely the best ever! We will definitely visit the Acacia again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best service and most amazing atmosphere Iâ€™ve ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: AaronPHX85015
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin??? My partner and I and our two friends checked into the Acacia the weekend before our cruise embarked for a week in the Caribbean, and I have to say, staying at the Acacia was one of the major highlights of our entire trip! We checked in late on a Friday evening, and the Operations Manager, Chad, was there waiting to check us in. This was our first trip to San Juan, and wanting to experience the flavor of Puerto Rico by staying somewhere that wasnâ€™t a big chain, the Acacia Boutique Hotel BY FAR exceeding our expectations!! Not only was the hotel one of the nicest, coziest, boutique type of hotels Iâ€™ve ever stayed in, the customer service provided by Chad was off the charts!!!! I have never received that kind of service anywhere in the world that Iâ€™ve traveled!! As soon as you walk through the front door, you know this place is going to be special! It felt like walking into a spa! The accompanying restaurant on the property, Niche, was absolutely delicious! I am still craving the grilled lobster and risotto dish that I had there my first night. And the mojitos were probably the best I had during my entire vacation!!! Not only was the service flawless, the rooms were quaint and the entire hotel offered exactly what we were hoping for! â€¦and did I mention Chadâ€™s customer service? (smile). By the time the 4 of us had to check out and leave for our cruise ship, we were all practically group-hugging Chad. We miss him dearly! This hotel is located about a half block from the beach, and our room was perfect! It was clean, comfortable, and in a prime location! Not only was the GIANT hot tub right outside our door, but we had a wonderful view of the ocean and palm tree lined beach! The next time my partner and I â€“ and any other friends who want to join us â€“ make a trip to San Juan, there is absolutely no other option but to make our lodging reservations with the Acacia Boutique Hotel!! Thanks, Chad, for getting our vacation definitely off on the right track!!! Your new friends, Aaron, R.C., Susan and Jennifer â€“ Phoenix, AZ

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daniboyjr
Reviews.Content: OMG! This was the most awesome stay in a hotel I've ever experienced. It's small and cozy but so intimate and personal. Our host, Chad, was the most gracious guy. He showed us around and took our bags to our room. When we needed a car, he was on the phone and a rental car company was there to pick us up within 10 minutes. The restaurant/bar is was excellent. Everyone there treated us like family. The food is exemplary. Bartenders & waiters treated us so nicely. Our room was cozy with an ocean view. This place is what I would consider highly recommended. The only negative part of my trip was the fact that I didn't have my dog with me.

Reviews.Title: “Acacia Hotel and Niche Restaurant are gems - Chad is a rock star”
Reviews.Author: mkguss74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are currently vacationing in Puerto Rico. I have a high stress job, and before the summer season gets busy, we thought it would be good to plan a short vacation. We are couple in our 30s from DC, and we love to travel. We take a few trips each year throughout the Caribbean, the U.S. and around the world. Initially, we looked at Acacia because of the amazing reviews, but settled on La Concha Renaissance because of Marriott points and the pools. The Renaissance is nice, but we wish we would have stayed at Acacia. During our trip, we had an opportunity to visit Acacia's restaurant, Niche, for dinner. I've eaten at many upscale restaurants in my time, but this is in my top 20 of dinners. The food was creative and amazing, plus the chef came out to greet us - very nice guy. Chad Siegel - I can't say enough. Chad manages the hotel, and is extremely knowledgeable, nice, and understands the importance of customer service. I work in PR, a very customer-service based business and I don't understand how people don't get it. Although we stayed at the Renaissance, Chad was our concierage. He was extremely patient with us, and took time to answer our questions and provide entertainment and restaurant recommendations, and we were not even staying at the Acacia. Honestly, the concierage at the Renaissance was not as helpful or knowledgeable. Our experience in Puerto Rico would have been miserable if we didn't stop by Niche and talk with Chad. He also took the time to give us a tour of the hotel - absolutely romantic and beautiful. We were bummed because we saw what we were missing. The next time I visit Puerto Rico, I'm staying at Acacia and booking room #307. Acacia - Mike and Catrell thank you for taking such good care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Chad's a rock star!”
Reviews.Author: mikeoncea
Reviews.Content: I don't think I could say enough good things about this place without writing a novel! Having never been to Puerto Rico, we read the reviews and found this place to be highly recommended, especially the service. Certainly any future trip or place we stay will have a lot to compete with in order to top the Acacia. First, it had everything we wanted - not a big resort where you get lost. Not in the center of any tourist trap. Just about on the beach (a very short walk). Plenty of things to walk to, if you like to explore the local neighborhoods. Short trips to the touristy type attractions. Quiet and convenient, priced right and so on. The place is clean and nothing to worry about, but the real attractions to this place was the friendly people who work there, especially Rock Star Chad! We gave him that name because of all the people raving about him on these boards, and every word is true! He set us up with exactly what we wanted and made our stay memorable. We've been friends since the moment we met him and will always keep in touch! And, you get to know all the staff when you stay here and are treated more like friends than guests. At the hotel, be sure to have the Mojitos and the mussels at their restaurant - Niche. We always made it a point to start or end at Niche and it truly has some of the best food on the island. Small and quaint, it felt more like having dinner and drinks at a friend's house. And, whether we wanted to go to a fancy restaurant or grab good local food, find nightlife or take an excursion, Chad's recommendations were spot on!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: mjf1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before a cruise. The property is a block from the beach in a residential neighborhood. The hotel's common areas and restaurant are updated and there is a very large hot tub for guests. The rooms are very comfortable and quiet with large balconies; however, they are somewhat less updated than the rest of the property. The restaurant is excellent. The staff here is great. Everyone is helpful and friendly, especially Chad at the front desk. He is probably the most helpful person I have ever encountered at a hotel. If you're interested in a huge five-star resort, this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a relaxed stay near the beach, this is greatly recommended. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Total package for a relaxed getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Philip1965
Reviews.Content: They cannot do enough for you at this friendly hotel. Nice tropical themed rooms that are very clean. Quiet is the key here and you never hardly see the staff! I would totally recommend this place and be coming back fir sure.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Perfection at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Anibalinski
Reviews.Content: This is the kind of experience I love: not knowing what to expect and getting the best I could desire! My partner and me are delighted to recommend the Acacia Inn in the fine neighbourhood of Condado, Ocean Park. A fine boutique hotel with no over 21 rooms is excellent in every way. From the fine cuisine from chef Christian to the friendly smiles and care the whole staff gives you, specially my darling Brendaâ€¦I love this place!!! Lynette, one of the owners was also of great help guiding us to the beautiful experience it was going to Vieuqes and to another property of the group called Blue Horizon which is another experience of its own I will have to make an extensive review. Both are my stars beyond priceless, made my vacation stay a dream come true. Thank you guys!! (Forgot I love the lap pool size whirlpool!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service was great. Chad went beyond the norm to offer 1st rate hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Stevorino78259
Reviews.Content: The check in was a bit confusing as you have to go to the parent hotel to check in, but it's just down the street. Perhaps that is because we got there before 1:00 PM check in time. For a small 21 room hotel/restaurant attached, this place is worth the experience. The hot tub is very large and could easily accomodate 20 people. A view from the room over the hot tub offers a peek of the ocean which beckons a visit daily. The restaurant "Niche" is a great place to relax and enjoy a drink and some of the best food prepared by an award winning chef. You will not be disappointed in the preparation, presentation and ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: NancyinPayson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Acacia for two nights prior to a cruise. The hotel was clean, charming, very comfortable. Pool/jacuzzi/fountain was quite relaxing. Staff was great and the coffee in the restaurant is the best we've had anywhere!!!! Be sure to have breakfast there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our destination wedding!”
Reviews.Author: lscola126
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with 50 of our friends and family to San Juan for our wedding last March and chose At Wind Chimes and its sister hotel, Acacia, for our guests to stay at. Acacia is definitely the more upscale hotel of the two, though both were lovely. This hotel was exactly what we were looking for! The rooms were clean and spacious and the staff was phenomenally accommodating with the many demands of such a large group. Chad at Acacia was one of the most helpful people I have ever met and made my grandparents and cousins who were in PR for the first time feel welcome and at home. He rocks! The huge hot tub at Acacia was perfect for our friends and family to hang out and relax at the end of the day. Guests have access to both properties- which was great for us, as we were a large group and were coming and going between hotels constantly. The location is fantastic- one block from the beach and a ten minute walk from many restaurants and shops. All of our guests felt incredibly safe in the neighborhood- even when a few of the guys decided to take a stroll at 2:00 AM on the night of our wedding! The restaurant was phenomenal and was even able to handle our orders when 35 of our guests took over the space on our last night. The food was turned out perfectly and in a timely fashion, even with so many diners. We loved our stay here so much that we decided to return for the one night we had in San Juan on the way home from our honeymoon in Vieques and had another fabulous night's stay there. Many people have complained about parking on here. We chose not to rent a car (nor did any of our guests) as we had transportation to and from all wedding events planned. I can imagine parking in this neighborhood would be difficult. However, cabs- vans actually- were timely (less than 3 minutes for most after calling) and affordable... It was 15 minutes and $15 from the airport or Old San Juan. This is a lovely, very reasonably priced boutique hotel. We found it to be perfect for our group and needs. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, fantastic sevice”
Reviews.Author: danfishcom
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and myself spent 2 nites at the Acacia and we could not have been more pleased with the location and the service. Very short walk to a fantastic beach. The fellow who was at the desk, I regret I forget his name, could not have been more helpful. My girlfriend left her purse in a taxi and he got immediately on the phone and made a call. The taxi driver turned around and brought the purse to the front door. (a very honest fellow who could'nt speak a lick of english) The fellow at the hotel recommended some fantastic restaurants and the native puerto ricans could not have been nicer. Oh yea, an unbelievable jacuzzi. If there was one drawback, no in room coffee. Overall fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Second time there was even better than the first!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle60795
Reviews.Content: Perfect getaway for spring break to relax, read, siwm in pool or at the beach which is steps away. Safe, convenient neighborhood. Was warmly greeted by manager, Chad. Was always there to make sure everything was going well without being intrusive. Kept cool concoction of ice cold water flavored with fresh fruit or veggies available..simple but refreshing! Allowed me to get in an "extra" day by storing luggage and providing a shower area to freshen up before leaving for the airport which is minutes away. For someone like me, who was seeking a "self-imposed spa experience" it was perfect. Will be back next spring. Michelle

Reviews.Title: “Chad-ulous!”
Reviews.Author: Bobxtwo
Reviews.Content: My husband & I are not big hotel/resort-type people & truly enjoyed our 4-day stay at the Acacia. We liked the quiet residential location half a block from the beach; enormous hot tub; cozy, tastefully decorated room; delightful onsite restaurant (Niche) and other local restaurants nearby. Chad, the manager, was very helpful & provided excellent service. The only drawback -- the shower in our room didn't work well, especially the hot water supply. But with the hot tub just steps away, we really didn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepy location, dirty beach management sucks”
Reviews.Author: meye
Reviews.Content: This review is late but better late than never. We were moved from downstairs to upstairs as our room had no hot water. But, 3hrs later while enjoying the jacuzzi the front desk informed us we had to move out or pay more. after luggin our luggage two flights of stairs we refused to move. next morning cleaning lady came thumping on our door. who does that??? would i stay here again- NO! pros: building is well maintained, rooms were clean, jacuzzi cons: management needs to change, beach is mediocre, residential, sleepy neghborhood, no elevator

Reviews.Title: “It was a charming boutique hotel with an exceptional staff.”
Reviews.Author: spmsbm
Reviews.Content: We were most pleasantly surprised by this little gem of a hotel a block from the beach in the Condado section of San Juan. It had a restaurant in the hotel that was intimate and upscale with attentive service. It also had a spa pool that was a wonderful experience after a long day out and about. The owner operator , Chad was there about 16 hours a day and was very amiable, quite knowledgeable about the area and extremely helpful. The hotel was quite clean and well kept. All of the staff were very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Clean, Friendly Staff, and A Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: bmanning1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent five nights at The Acacia. We were greeted immediately by the very friendly and helpful Director of Guest Services, Chad Siegel. Throughout our vacation, he seemed to take a genuine interest in our experience in San Juan. He provided recommendations on everything from restaurants to day trips. If we wanted to do something, we simply told him and he made it happen. Chad recently took over the daily operations of The Acacia, so pay close attention to the most recent reviews for an accurate portrayal of what you can expect. The hotel is conveniently located near beaches, restaurants, bars, casinos, and shopping. If you desire a calm beach atmosphere simply walk half a block from the hotel. If a beach party complete with locals dancing to reggaeton is more your speed, you can walk a couple of blocks east. Additionally, a restaurant row with a diversity of restaurants to satisfy any taste are within walking distance. If a quiet night in is what you desire, then dine at Niche in the hotel and enjoy cocktails in the large jacuzzi. Be sure to try the Duck Confit Tacos! I highly recommend traveling to Puerto Rico and staying at The Acacia to anyone! Chad (who seems to always be there) will take great care of you and ensure you are a repeat customer.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfully comfortable little gem with a very helpful manager”
Reviews.Author: Dianek8788
Reviews.Content: Acacia is a little gem of a place less than a block from the beach. The rooms are clean and comfortable, but on the small size by American standards. The manager, Chad Siegel, went out of his way several times to make sure our stay was great. He stored our luggage willingly while we went to the beach on check out day and provided us with towels and a shower after our day on the beach and before heading off for our cruise ship. It's the people that can make or break your experience, and he was definitely the person that made our stay a great one! Kuddos and thanks! We'll definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay anywhere else in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaGirl79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a vacation to San Juan, and we had the pleasure of staying at Acacia Seaside Inn. We originally had a room reserved at "At the Windchimes," but were told upon arrival that we had been moved to their sister hotel, Acacia. I am so glad we got switched! Chad, the director of guest services, was extremely helpful throughout our stay. We basically told him what we wanted to do, and he set everything up for us and gave us honest feedback about which excursions were worth the money versus which ones were a waste of money. He even prepared a cooler of snacks for us for one of our outings, without us even asking!! Our room was great, with a comfortable bed and nice sized bathroom, and plenty of space to store our clothes and things. The jacuzzi is GIGANTIC and the perfect temperature, with plenty of little nooks for couples to have privacy--it was honestly about the same size as the swimming pool at Windchimes! Also, there is a restaurant--Niche--inside the hotel and the food is amazing. The chef apparently recently won an award and it was easy to see why after enjoying tapas for dinner one night. They also serve breakfast--BEST PANCAKES I HAVE EVER HAD!!!! The location of Acacia was also prime--a very safe area, a half-block from the beach and a short walk to tons of restaurants and stores. All in all, a fabulous experience and I look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical oasis in the heart of Condado”
Reviews.Author: L0vetree
Reviews.Content: The Acacia is a wonderful little boutique hotel located in the Condado district of San Juan. If you are looking for an alternative to the big resort style complexes then this is the place for you. My girlfriend and I recently had the pleasure of staying there for 12 fantastic days, using it as a base to explore San Juan. The hotel itself has a trendy boutique feel and is literally about 20 steps from the beach. The room we stayed in was a little small however the huge wrap around balcony and beautiful ocean view more than made up for it. I can't really say enough about the service at the hotel. The director of customer service, Chad, was very friendly and super accommodating. He provided us with a lot of great suggestions about restaurants to eat at, places to visit, and tours to go on. The hotel is within walking distance of a lot of great restaurants in Condado and Ocean Park - although be aware that the area is fairly touristy and therefore a lot of the restaurants and bars can be a little bit pricey. Make sure to take advantage of the happy hour specials! If you are looking for a place to party you have to check out La Placita. It's about a 15 min walk from the hotel and is essentially a little plaza area with a bunch of local restaurants and bars that get really busy on the weekend. From the hotel we visited Old San Juan (about a 15 dollar cab ride), visited the Bioluminescent bay, Camuy Caves, went horse back riding (talk to Chad, he knows an excellent guide), and did some zip-lining and repelling in the rain forest. Overall we had a great time at the Acacia and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Acacia is Shinning Again”
Reviews.Author: Benjmq
Reviews.Content: This small trendy hotel located one minute from San Juan's beautiful beach has recommitted itself to welcoming its guests with a smile and with great service. Having stayed at this trendy boutique hotel in 2010 experiencing a less than welcoming management with an "attitude" I decided to give this "gem" another try. I am so glad that I did give the Acacia another opportunity to show me that its staff and management really are happy to serve you and your needs, whatever thay may be. General manager, Brenda is an such a wonderful and friendly addition to this property,and, guest services manager Chad will provide anything that you could possibly need to make your stay at Acacia a very memorable experience. Niche, the fabulous in hotel restaurant is one of the islands hidden jewels for local fare with all the special attention to details that a foody would expect. Chef Oscar has become one of the islands most respected chefs. Try the duck confit tacos to start your meal. The whole red snapper is muy delicioso! After dinner enjoy a quiet soaking in the enormous hot tub. The Acacia is a special place, again! It sparkles and leaves you with a twinkle in your eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Touringtwo022
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three nights with my wife. Excellent Condado location half-block from beach, nice tile work and design, large warm soaking pool on roof, and always someone on duty at the reception area. Chad is the director of guest services, and made us feel very welcome. He also arranged a day trip to Ponce. Superb chef and sous-chef (expensive but worth it), with a well-stocked bar. They make excellent mojitos. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and really good value for money made our holiday in Puerto Rico get off to a good start!”
Reviews.Author: Pryan20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Acacia Seaside Inn at the beginning and end of our trip to Puerto Rico. I was really pleased to find it really did live up to it's name as a boutique style hotel yards away from the beach. This hotel has only a few rooms, which for me was part of the draw to it in the first place. The staff are really friendly and helpful with local information bookings or just anything else you need! Our first room looked out onto their lovely natural looking spa pool, which is very inviting.The room was comfortable and with a balcony to look and listen to the ocean or the singing coqui frogs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and restaurant for a few days at the beach!”
Reviews.Author: JohnandKathleen
Reviews.Content: A reasonably priced small hotel, a terrific location, about 200 feet from a great beach. Rooms with balconies have ocean and beach views, palms swaying. A huge and wonderful jaccuzi was an unexpected surprise. The staff are very friendly, solicitous, and knowledgeable about local restaurants and excursions. Rooms are attractive, comfortable and nicely decorated. The Acacia is home to Niche, a shockingly good restaurant for a boutique hotel, a food experience we would recommend to anyone going to San Juan. Chef Oscar Martinez is cooking at a very high level deserves all the attention and excitement of an up and coming star!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: anneclr
Reviews.Content: My family, including 2 daughters, did not want to stay at one of the big resort hotels and were very pleased with Acacia. The location is great for walking to local restaurants for a taste of real Puerto Rican food. The beach is beautiful, the hot tub is huge! Chad, the concierge, helped us plan the most fun day trips ever! We were able to get private tours to everything we wanted to see..... Rain forest, zip-lining, bio-bay, horseback riding, and the caves. He really understood what we wanted and was there to make it happen with a smile. Overall, we had a fantastic time and would recommend this hotel for people that want an off the beaten path fun, relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel by the beach with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Cam627
Reviews.Content: Our room had a view of the beach 50 yards away and of the large jacuzzi pool. Decorated tastefully with lots of rock and tile. The staff especially Chad were very helpful with great recommendations for food and activities. Large sundeck on roof and NIche restaurant were pluses. Room size was on the small side with a terrace. In a centrally located residential neighborhood so activities/amenties were a walk or a cab ride away. A bit noisy at night for a small hotel. We had a very enjoyable stay and would return. .

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Tranquil”
Reviews.Author: WanderLone
Reviews.Content: I had a one week stay in Puerto Rico. I spent my first five days in Old San Juan, I tried out a few hotels there. After all the partying and sight seeing was done, I was ready for a nice place to relax. When I first arrived the front door was locked and there was a note telling me to go to another hotel to check in. It was about half a block away. This was a little frustrating because it was pretty warm out and I had all my luggage with me. When I checked in there was a very nice lady at the desk. Despite her printer not working properly, check in was pretty quick. The only reason I mention that is because once I walked into the lobby of the Acacia I noticed all brand new state of the art equipment at the desk making me wonder why they don't just bring that over to the Wind Chimes Hotel check in, nobody uses it in Acacia. Those were all the troubles I had there. Once you enter the lobby, you are blown away by beautiful paintings on the all and foliage everywhere. I went up the wrong stairs at first (no elevator) but was very impressed with the architecture and decor. I finally found my room and it looked better than the photos on the website. I turned on the A/C right away because it was a little warm, then opened the French doors to the balcony. I had a fantastic view of the bluest white sand beach in the world. The balcony was massive and wrapped around my entire room. The bathroom was small but well done. The first thing I did was go to the beach. It had to have been the most beautiful beach I have ever seen. No exaggeration. Then when I returned I headed to the pool. It was very different from anything I had ever seen so I had to try it out. The first thing I noticed was how perfect the water was. Not so cold that it shocks you once you touch it, but not warm either, it was perfect. I spent about an hour basking in the sun and listening to the waves crash on the beach. It was the perfect way to relax. When I returned to my room I took a shower. The water pressure was right on and the shower was pretty nice as well. I was exhausted from partying the night before so I opened the balcony doors, layed on the bed and passed out immediately. The warm air and cool a/c made for a great combination of temperatures followed by the crashing waves. I have not slept that soundly in years. Both nights I stayed there were just as pleasing and tranquil. It was a perfect way to end a great stay in Puerto Rico. The night shift lady at the Wind Chimes desk was very helpful when I asked where to go for dinner and a drink. It was only about a mile away. There were many bars and restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a Puerto Rican vacation”
Reviews.Author: Carigiet
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to PR and were not sure what to expect. This hotel was off the tourist area by a few blocks in the neighborhood of Condado. It was quiet, relaxing and everything that we could have asked for and more. There is no doubt in my mind that we will be staying here on our next trip. From the layout of the building to the decor, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the great service”
Reviews.Author: formershrink
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit, so I knew about the nice rooms and great location. During my stay, I experienced a personal emergency that required the assistance of the hotel management. The general manager handled the situation with great skill and compassion, and I was very pleased with her helpful service. I'd also mention that she was completely professional in a situation in which some gay-unfriendly attitudes could have appeared -- she was gay-friendly at a time when it really counted.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Right by the Water”
Reviews.Author: MsBlondo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Acacia Inn and was pleased with the boutique feel that this place had. The rooms were small but efficient. The jucuzzi is huge! I initially thought it was a swimming pool. The front desk was very helpful and got us a great deal on a rental car. Location is perfect since you are steps from the beach but can also easily hop on the highway and head to Fajardo and hop a ferry to Culebra (a must for any puerto rico trip may I add). Great value, service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get away with excellent service and ambiance.”
Reviews.Author: canomyrn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Acacia after a week long cruise and could not have been happier. The Hotel Manager, Paul, went out of his way to make us feel welcome and even chatted with us about the history of the hotel. It was quiet, comfortable, and the food at the "Niche" downstairs was amazing. We walked down to the restaurant, "La Tasca de Yiyo" about two blocks down for an early dinner and the food, service, presentation of the food made us feel as if we were in a five star restaurant in New York. After dinner we sat in the very beautiful hot tub and relaxed. The beach was a block down the street and very quiet and felt very private. Paul and staff were amazing. We would definitely come back and stay at the Acacia.

Reviews.Title: “return visitor (fourteen times in the last three years)”
Reviews.Author: Axababe
Reviews.Content: Great time ... travelled with family, Small kids , friends & Solo ...The staff is great yes they are limited but that the way it should be ... Ive stayed on all floors lots of rooms .. but have to admit my favourite rooms are 208 & 206 ... right outside the hot tub....

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!! DOUBLE BEDS PUSHED TOGETHER PASSED OFF AS KING!!!”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter1435
Reviews.Content: As soon as we got to Acacia we saw that the door was locked and there was a note on it saying if you need anything walk to the Wind Chimes one block down. When the trip was confirmed no one told us we would have to be lugging all of our things down the street to some random hotel. When we got there the door was locked and we finally difgured out that you had to ring an intercom. Once we got there the woman at the desk was nice but seemed frustrated at all of our questions. We felt very rushed. We booked our trip through travelocity and paid extra for a king sized bed. We were also told we would have an ocean view room. When we got there, the AC was off and it was so hot!! Our view was also of a white stucco wall about 2 feet from our window. The room was miniscule. There was not even a clock to be found. The TV was small and the remote did not even work. The phone in the room didn't even have any extension numbers on it. AS I began to reluctantly unpack our things, my husband realized that the bed in our room was not King, a big gap down the middle of the bed showed that it was two double beds pulled together and draped with a king sized comforter!!!! We immediately called tracelocity. We were only there for a weekend, so we didn't want to waste time in the junky hotel so we decided to head to get some food and sit on the beach. I spent over and hour on the phone with travelocity because the hotel kept putting them on hold. The hotel said that they had no more king rooms available so that is why we got put in a fake king. I refused to cave in, so finally they told travelocity they would move us to a queen bed for that night and a deluxe king the next night. We agreed and told them we would be there within the next two hours to switch rooms. When we got there, the woman at the front desk was different than the one who checked us in. She was NASTY!!! I told her we were there to switch our room, and she tells me that the room we were in was considered a king so we were not getting another room. I of focurse flipped out and she started raising her voice at me calling me by my first name. My husnamd and I have traveled around the world and never have we been called m=by our first name. Unprofessional!!!!! I told her that travelocity assured us of the arrangement, and she basically told me too bad-the man who was staying in the delux king decided after the fact he wanted to stay longer so they gave away my room. The manager I believe then got involved and they convinced us to look at their Queen beds. we had already wasted so much time and we were only there for two days that we decided to stay. The only reason was because this room had a balcony and a semi descent view. Later that evening a bottle of champagne was sent up to our room as some sort of peace offering I guess, but that didn't change the fact that there was no service, you had to walk to antoehr hotel to get assistance, they re-hung a dirty stained towel I had deliberately had on the floor to dry my feet out of the shower instead of provide fresh ones. They were not helpful when you asked questions about where to go, what to do, etc... They were terrible!!!! Save yourelf money and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cozy, friendly, has character”
Reviews.Author: Travisbg
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here from June 23-27, and we enjoyed our stay very much (it is a gay-friendly hotel, and we felt very welcome). It is a very unique hotel with a great location that is steps from the beach, a short walk to the Condado shops/restaurants, has a very friendly staff, and has a very tasty restaurant (Niche Restaurant) right on the premises. The room had air-conditioning, a small fridge, a microwave, and a small TV. If you stay here or are just in the area, you MUST try this restaurant: it seats maybe 20 people, has a lot of character to it, and the food is sooooo good. You have to try the mussels as an appetizer! If I had to pick one thing that I'd change about the hotel, I'd say that our room was small-sized, but it didn't really make a difference to us, since we spent most of our time on our private ocean-view balcony, out on the beach, or sight-seeing! I highly recommend staying here! Liked Best: Location, hotel character, hot tub Liked Least: Room size

Reviews.Title: “nice but lacking all services”
Reviews.Author: colfaxmpls
Reviews.Content: very cute place. NO internet. NO staff on duty. If you are going to relax and need no staff nor any internet, it is not a bad deal. If you need more than a rented bed, don't bother. The wind chimes is where the staff and the wireless exists (one block away). They tell business visitors or anyone needing the internet to sit in the lobby of the other hotel........ not good if you need to get work done. Too bad really because with a little effort, they could really have a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Boutique Hotel near the Beach”
Reviews.Author: DavidColumbusOhio
Reviews.Content: I'm a budget travler. The hotel was a little dated but has lots of atmosphere... Spanish Motif.. with large whirlpool, and restaurant. Its sister property ...Wind Chimes.. down the street has a pool and bar. The hotel is located just a few steps from the beach. Got great rates through Cheaptickets for $99 x 3 days plus a free night. I overheard someone calling the hotel and got room rates cheaper than that. Rooms are small.. room for two and you will be bumping into each other. The in rooom safe cost $2 per day which was not indicated on Cheaptickets web site. Desk employees are english speaking. Right down the street from fast food places like Fudruckers, BK, and Subway if you are on a budget. There is a big grocery store " Pueblo de Diego" on De Diego and Wilson about 4 blocks down off of Ashford ...( McLeary turns into Ashford 3 blocks toward town..The first street you will pass is Kings Ct) ... if you want to buy something to take to the beach and they also have prepared food that you can eat in the store. Spanish is spoken in most places, workers understand some english if you ask for something without a lot of filler words.. "one Criolla salad to go, balsamic dressing " If you say Hi first, usually they know you speak english. Read the reviews on traveladvisor before booking the trip and the only consistent complaint about the hotel was that the rooms were small and it was out of the way. No view from the first floor and those must be the cheaper rooms, but if you only need it to sleep and clean up, it worth it. Driving is New York style in the evenings. The hotel is perfect if you want to relax on a quiet beach and dine out. It is pretty safe if you stay on the streets near Ashford and McLeary. There are Casinos and bars in the area that i'm sure can offer a lot to do.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice little intimate boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jenn123444
Reviews.Content: Husband/wife in our 40's. We stayed 5/27 to 5/31 and got a great deal (with airfare) on Travelocity. Upon check in, they upgraded our room to ocean front (we had to downsize from a King Bed to Queen Bed) but that was fine by me as I wanted the view/balcony more than the bed size. We showed up at Acacia to check in and Paul advised us that all check ins are done at Wind Chimes Inn. This is their â€˜sisterâ€™ hotel and its only steps from Acacia. I was also able to chat with Paul a few minutes about some dining selections that I had done some research on and got some great feedback from him. Checkin / Checkout: No issues. She even called us a taxi at checkout & the arrived within 3 minutes. Common Areas: Beautiful lobby and eclectic common areas. Wonderful large hot tub. Can only get into hotel main doors with your room key so very safe. Room: Small but clean/nice. Some minor cracks in the ceiling & around the French doors, but that didnâ€™t bother us. Comfortable bed, GREAT AC unit which kept the room very cool (and it was very humid during our stay). No room clock, large dresser and two end tables to store you items from home. The mirror on the large dresser had some type of filminess to it which made it unusable, but I was able to use the bathroom mirror so not a huge issue for us. Bathroom: Small but updated/modern. Bar soap, shampoo, plastic cups and hairdryer all were provided. Clean towels supplied daily. Balcony: Wonderful and large. We were on the corner so we had a front and side balcony with one plastic chair. Nice to relax and read a book for awhile when your partner is getting ready inside the room. Location: Perfect for us. We had no rental car so we either walked or used taxis. The taxi ride far (with tip) was about $20 to and from the hotel. We also took a taxi into San Juan one day and then took the public bus (C53) back from San Juan to our hotel. BIG mistake, by the time we waited in San Juan at the bus depot and took the actual bus, we had an hour and half in that. Didnâ€™t use the bus system anymore. Much too time consuming. It was cheap ($.75 PP) but not worth that much time while we are on vacation. The taxi ride was 10 minutes to/from San Juan (as we had no traffic). For the most part, we walked everywhere (refer to Dining Reviews on: Jam Rum Bar, Waikiki, Starbucks, Kasalta Bakery) as Iâ€™ll put walking times and miles from the hotel in those reviews. Niche Restaurant: Very small, yet romantic. Niche Martini is wonderful. Hubby had lobster & loved it. I had received feedback from a local at the beach to order the shrimp risotto (on the appetizer side of menu) but ask for the portion size to be an entrÃ©e. So I asked for that and guess what? They served and charged me for the $12 appetizer. I was disappointed and left hungry. Had to stop somewhere else later in the evening & order something else to eat. We made a great friend in Kayla. She is the bartender/mixologist and was WONDERFUL. She flipâ€™s between Niche and the Boat Bar (located at the Wind Chimes inn). She is friendly, informative and really does love her job. She made the best drinks for us at both places. We hope to stay in touch with her via Facebook. Overall, we were very pleased with Acacia and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value”
Reviews.Author: Melvis_and_Laugh
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel through a guidebook and it was the only one in our price range with a vacancy. Everyone else missed out. Acacia is booked and managed by At Wind Chimes, and is half a block away. Half a block closer to the beach. A large number of the rooms have partial beach views, and it's a literal half a block to the sand. Rooms are small, but comfy, with walk-in showers (nice when you're covered in sand.) No elevator, so you earn your view. The most amazing hot tub I've ever seen- it's enormous, beautiful, and well-kept. The pool is at the other property, but we never made the walk to see it. The Condado district is a 5 minute walk. Beware the beach! The section of beach immediately in front of the hotel is prone to a stout rip current, so walk a little ways in either direction if you plan to do some swimming.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful stay at boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: wege1948
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at the acacia inn during our vacation in san juan. only three floors, 1/2 short block to beach. room 301 had balcony that you could see the ocean. clean tile floor rooms, excellent air conditioning, but we enjoyued the open windows at night to hear the waves. safe location as we walked the beach every night. streets just as safe as we could walk a short distance to numerous outdoor resturants at night. short public bus$.75 to old san juan. friendly office. paul had great advice on day trips to rain forest, etc. best treat was great resturant right on sight. have the tuna. we will return again for a great stay in wonderful historic city.

Reviews.Title: “The no-service hotel”
Reviews.Author: formershrink
Reviews.Content: Terrific location (steps from the beach), attractive building, NO SERVICE! The hotel desk is not staffed -- if you want anything, you have to walk a block to the sister hotel, At Wind Chimes Inn. I arrived at precisely the time I had given when I made the reservation, and there was no one to be found. I stood with my luggage out in the rain, since all doors were locked and there was no one around. Internet in lobby only worked for brief periods of time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and quaint”
Reviews.Author: DainyRays
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Acacia as well as At Wind Chimes (a sister hotel) and both are great! I highly recommend them--it is easy to stay in Condado and travel into Old San Juan and elsewhere. Big hot tub!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BostonLilybelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days in the spring and had a lovely time. The lobby is gorgeous and the staff in so nice and accommodating. Ok...so the rooms are nothing to write home about, but they're fine, and hopefully you're not spending all day in your room anyway! The hot tub is amazing, the beach is just steps away, and even their little restaurant is an attraction in its own right. The only negative I can think of is the fact that The Acacia is a little far from downtown. It's definitely within walking distance of some restaurants, but to get to Old San Juan, you'd need a cab or a car (which I would recommend in Puerto Rico anyway). Also, the street that the Acacia is on is quite small and not well lit, which can make it a little "shady" feeling at night. Still, I never felt unsafe and I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Looking good from the outside only”
Reviews.Author: ElleMG
Reviews.Content: Rooms - really bad ventilation Hotel Bar/Restoration - none, except for the sister hotel nearby Pool - looks good on a photo only, but pretty useless, runs are too narrow Beach - close, but not great. Had to take a taxi to go to the nearest nice beach ($15 each way or by bus that stops once in 40-50 min)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Lil Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tostheim
Reviews.Content: We had reservastions to stay At Wind Chimes Inn. Our stay was during slow season so they bumped us up to their sister hotel The Acacia closer to the beach. We were pleased. The room was so-so, not as clean as we would like. The rest of the hotel and location was awesome. We had a view of the beach from our balcony and the restaurant and lobby were nice. I would recommend this hotel chain for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and accommodating. Beautiful place to stay, especially for the price!”
Reviews.Author: luv2shopHamptonRoads
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was hesitant to stay at this hotel because of the reviews posted here on tripadvisor.com. However, I am glad this was the hotel of choice. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable of the area. The hotel was very hospitable, clean, and well worth the money. Many of the reviews complained about the size of the TV. But this did not matter to me because I did not travel to Puerto Rico to watch TV. I waited too late to book my room so my last night there I had to stay at the sister hotel Wind Chime. All the reviews catered to Wind Chime but I felt like Wind Chime was nasty and dirty. There was hair in the tub and I barely wanted to sleep there. Although I did not care for the rooms at Wind Chime I must say that the Tiki bar was nice. The bartenders were funny and the music was relaxing. If you visit Puerto Rico make sure to check out the Acacia Seaside Inn. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heart-beat!”
Reviews.Author: Pixxiefly
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful location next to the beach, go out the front, turn you head left and you see the ocean. The staff were all very helpful and friendly, The rooms were clean and the food was very good! This hotel has a laid back atmosphere that screams VACATION. The beach outside was not crowded at all and very clean. The hotel is in a convenient location to the airport (just a short taxi ride) and is a short bus ride to Old San Juan. The only thing about this hotel that I saw as a problem was the floors. Yes, the floors. Many of the walkways are exposed to the outside and are a smooth surface (ie no non slip treads). So they present a fall hazard when wet. If you are accident prone I caution you. Otherwise, it was a very lovely place and was well worth the money. I would stay here again, no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable experience, beautiful Inn close to ocean!!!”
Reviews.Author: ringram
Reviews.Content: The minute I checked in, I found I was upgraded to the Acacia Inn, a half block to the ocean. Was booked in at The Wind Chimes Inn, but both properties are owned by the same person, and therefore they upgraded me to Acacia Inn. Room 201 was perfect, king size bed, nice bathroom and shower all done in the terracotta tile. The beautiful view from balcony was towards the ocean and you could have your morning coffee on the balcony every morning. Only disadvantage was no coffee machine, so if you are in need of a coffee first thing in the morning, bring your favorite instant coffee, boil/warm water up in microwave, and you are set. Small fridge, but just perfect for what you need. Very clean and efficient maid/cleaning service daily.
